opportunities.title: Immediate recovery plan to rebuild trust
opportunities.description: The client explicitly stated they would not use Korn Ferry again and has already moved a current senior search to another provider. A targeted recovery plan is needed to prevent further erosion across the group relationship and to reopen dialogue.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Would you use them again? – No and to be honest, we have a senior role now, but I've gone somewhere else..."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Have a senior Korn Ferry leader request a reset meeting, acknowledge gaps, and present a concrete remediation plan (process changes, service guarantees, and value-add) to earn a second chance.

opportunities.title: Tighten candidate quality and screening standards
opportunities.description: Shortlisted candidates were perceived as average and clearly unsuitable within minutes, indicating weak calibration and/or screening against the brief. Improving quality will directly address the core dissatisfaction driver.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Some of the people on the shortlist had minimal experience... after five minutes, you knew they just were nowhere near what you wanted."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Run a stricter qualification process (must-have criteria, structured scorecards, and pre-interview validation) and share the screening rationale with the client before presenting candidates.

opportunities.title: Clarify complex matrix role briefs upfront
opportunities.description: The client felt Korn Ferry did not understand the matrix nature of the COO role, which likely drove misaligned candidates and frustration. More rigorous discovery and role-definition work is needed at the start of the search.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I think they struggled to understand what the matrix nature of the organization... was... that lack of understanding has probably led to the quality of candidates not being as what it should be."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Add a mandatory deep-dive briefing workshop (stakeholder mapping, success profile, decision rights in the matrix, and 90-day outcomes) before launching sourcing.

opportunities.title: Shift from 'difficult role' to solutions
opportunities.description: The consultant repeatedly emphasized difficulty rather than offering options, which reduced confidence and made the engagement feel unhelpful. The client wants proactive problem-solving and adjustments when the market is tight.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "It was almost an element of, this is really difficult... rather than try to find me a solution."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a proactive search governance cadence where each update includes market feedback plus 2–3 concrete options (spec changes, target pools, compensation levers, or alternative profiles).

opportunities.title: Provide clear compensation and package guidance
opportunities.description: The client experienced weak ownership and unclear answers on candidate expectations and negotiation, creating friction at offer stage. Stronger market benchmarking and candidate expectation management would improve outcomes.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "When it came to saying... let's negotiate. What does she expect? And the answer was, I don't know."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Bring compensation benchmarks and a documented candidate expectation range into shortlist stage, and assign the consultant clear responsibility for negotiation support.

opportunities.title: Define who leads offer and negotiation
opportunities.description: There was misalignment on whether Korn Ferry or the client should lead the initial offer and negotiation, causing confusion and reducing perceived value. A clear, agreed offer process would prevent repeat issues.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "My view was that that initial offer and negotiation should come by the agency... But he felt that was our role, not his."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Standardize an offer/closing playbook and confirm roles and responsibilities in writing at kickoff (including who leads verbal offer, negotiation, and documentation).

opportunities.title: Increase proactive engagement and update cadence
opportunities.description: The client compared Korn Ferry unfavorably to competitors who provide weekly proactive updates and market insight. Improving cadence and proactivity would strengthen partnership perception.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "[Hunter Healthcare]... The lead consultant has been on the phone every week, without fail. Never had to chase them, and they're proactively engaging with us..."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Commit to a weekly standing update (plus ad-hoc updates when milestones occur) that includes pipeline metrics, market intel, and next-step recommendations.

opportunities.title: Be flexible around client availability
opportunities.description: The engagement felt one-sided, driven by consultant availability rather than the client’s needs. Improving scheduling flexibility and responsiveness would reduce friction and improve experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "We did both [have] fairly regular contact, although it was frequently based on when Thomas was available, maybe not when we were available."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Agree preferred communication windows and escalation paths at kickoff, and ensure backup coverage so the client can reach someone when needed.

opportunities.title: Address mandated-use resentment and rebuild partnership
opportunities.description: The relationship was undermined because Korn Ferry was perceived as imposed by the group, leading to low buy-in and a feeling of being taken for granted. Reframing the relationship around earned value is necessary to retain future work.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Nobody actually wanted to use Korn Ferry... it was pushed on them by the group." / "Korn Ferry... almost took us for granted a little bit."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Hold a stakeholder reset to clarify local needs, agree success measures, and demonstrate optional value (not entitlement) through tailored insights and service commitments.

opportunities.title: Ensure value when client provides candidate
opportunities.description: Paying high fees for a hire the client referred created a major value gap and damaged trust. Korn Ferry needs a clear policy and communication on fee fairness and value delivery in such cases.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "We've just paid 70 grand in fees for someone that we gave them, which feels a bit of a stink."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce and communicate a transparent approach for client-referred candidates (fee adjustment, added services, or credit) and reinforce what Korn Ferry delivers beyond sourcing.

opportunities.title: Leverage psychometrics as broader assessment offering
opportunities.description: The client found psychometric testing and reporting highly valuable, suggesting an opportunity to position Korn Ferry’s assessment capabilities as a differentiator beyond search. This could open doors to leadership assessment, team effectiveness, or selection support.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "The psychometric testing piece was very detailed and very good reporting... that really helped... that was really valuable."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose an assessment-led package for future senior hires (psychometrics, structured interviews, and onboarding insights) to rebuild credibility and expand services.

opportunities.title: Support for current and upcoming senior roles
opportunities.description: The client indicated they have a senior role now and will likely have future senior hiring needs, but is currently using other headhunters. Korn Ferry can still position for future opportunities if trust is rebuilt.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "...we have a senior role now, but I've gone somewhere else..."
opportunities.suggestedAction: After a recovery conversation, offer a low-risk pilot (e.g., market mapping or assessment-only support) to demonstrate improved delivery before asking for another retained search.

opportunities.title: Add value-add networking and industry introductions
opportunities.description: Competitors are winning favor by offering introductions, seminars, and health-sector invites that benefit the client’s broader team. Replicating or exceeding this value-add could deepen relationships beyond a single search.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Those had some value add stuff around we're going to make some introductions, and there's some seminars and invites... which would benefit some of my colleagues..."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a client value plan including relevant health-sector roundtables, introductions, and thought leadership sessions tailored to SYNLAB’s medical and operational leaders.

opportunities.title: Demonstrate stronger market knowledge and mapping
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry was perceived as less knowledgeable and less engaged than competitors who quickly articulated target organizations, constraints, and approach. Stronger upfront market mapping would improve confidence and outcomes.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Immediately, there was a sense of they understood the marketplace... They knew people in that space. They knew the organizations they couldn't talk to..."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Deliver an early market intelligence pack (target list, off-limits constraints, talent availability, and outreach plan) within the first 1–2 weeks of kickoff.

opportunities.title: Repeat senior-level executive search support
opportunities.description: Harry indicates he will return to Korn Ferry when future senior hiring needs arise, and would use the same team again. This is a clear signal of ongoing executive search demand tied to leadership changes or growth.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “When the need ultimately arises... you're going to go to people that you know and that you trust...” and “If it would happen again, I would choose exactly the same team.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a light-touch quarterly check-in to understand upcoming leadership needs and stay positioned as first call for senior searches.

opportunities.title: Strengthen Asian-market candidate coverage
opportunities.description: He wanted more candidates with deeper Asia experience, even acknowledging the market is young and supply is limited. Improving access to Asia-experienced talent (or clearly framing scarcity early) would increase perceived fit and reduce friction.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I would have liked to see someone with a lot more Asian experience... but... not necessarily a lot of those people exist, right?”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively map Asia-experienced talent pools (including adjacent-market proxies) and set expectations early with a market availability brief.

opportunities.title: Offer cost-scaled advisory beyond recruitment
opportunities.description: He views broader consultancy/OD as expensive for a small company and would not prioritize Korn Ferry for that work, despite valuing Korn Ferry’s quality. A right-sized, modular offering could unlock additional spend without triggering cost concerns.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I'm a small company... they are, of course, costly... would they come to me top of the list for an organizational development? No...”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a small-company package (fixed-fee, limited-scope) for targeted org/leadership advisory tied directly to hiring outcomes.

opportunities.title: Protect relationship with consistent team continuity
opportunities.description: Trust is the primary reason he chose Korn Ferry over investor-recommended alternatives, and he explicitly wants the same team again. Any change in points of contact could weaken the partnership and open the door to competitors.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I've been dealing with Korn Ferry... for probably two... maybe even three decades.” and “I would choose exactly the same team.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Maintain the same lead partners on the account and document relationship history/preferences to ensure seamless continuity if staffing changes occur.

opportunities.title: Ongoing executive searches across clinical leadership
opportunities.description: Carilion Clinic expects to continue using Korn Ferry for future executive searches beyond the current slate (six searches this year). This indicates a steady pipeline of leadership hiring needs where Korn Ferry can remain the default partner.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Tony strongly endorsed Korn Ferry and confirmed they would continue to use them for future searches.” (also: “five completed, a sixth in progress”)
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively schedule quarterly workforce/leadership planning check-ins to anticipate upcoming chair/director roles and lock in search timelines early.

opportunities.title: Provide compensation market data as input
opportunities.description: Although compensation benchmarking must be finalized internally for governance reasons, Korn Ferry data could still be valuable as an additional reference point. This is an opportunity to offer targeted compensation insights without positioning it as the final benchmark.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “if Korn Ferry had that information, it could help inform us as a data point, but it would not be the benchmark we would use in our final analysis.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a lightweight compensation insights add-on (role-specific market ranges and peer comparisons) packaged explicitly as a supporting data point for their internal process.

opportunities.title: Deepen use of Korn Ferry assessments
opportunities.description: Tony values Korn Ferry’s assessment tools as an additional data point alongside Carilion’s internal tools. There is room to expand assessment usage by tailoring outputs to complement their existing evaluation framework and decision meetings.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Korn Ferry's tool is good, it's helpful… it's just one additional data point for us as we think through how we assess our candidates.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Align assessment deliverables to Carilion’s internal evaluation criteria (e.g., mapping results to their competencies) and propose a consistent assessment step for finalist slates.

opportunities.title: Maintain rapid, always-on communication cadence
opportunities.description: Speed and responsiveness are a core value driver for Tony and directly tied to candidate experience and search efficiency. While not a complaint, it is a clear service requirement to preserve and operationalize.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We'll communicate at any time, any day… they're very responsive… timing in these searches is very important… I insist on very efficient searches.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Formalize response-time and update cadence norms (e.g., same-day feedback loops, proactive text alerts for changes) to ensure consistency across all searches and team members.

opportunities.title: Protect relationship-led approach vs. over-automation
opportunities.description: Tony explicitly values the human touch and does not believe AI/tech would improve the relationship component of the work. This is a signal to reinforce high-touch engagement and avoid leading with automation in this account.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “the human touch, the relationship is the key ingredient… I don’t think AI or tech innovation would enhance that in any meaningful way.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Reinforce a relationship-first account plan (regular executive touchpoints, high-touch candidate management) and position any tech only as behind-the-scenes efficiency, not a replacement for human interaction.

opportunities.title: Set upfront communication SLAs and channels
opportunities.description: Early-stage frustration stemmed from slow responses and a preference for calls over quick email replies. Aligning on response-time expectations, preferred channels, and cadence at kickoff would prevent misalignment and improve the client experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "we are a time sensitive organization...we're hearing back within two three hours... on occasion, instead of just replying to an email, there was a request to have a conversation"
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a standard kickoff “ways of working” agreement that documents SLAs (e.g., 2–3 hour response), channel preferences (email vs call), and update cadence.

opportunities.title: Maintain candidate pipeline until hire is cleared
opportunities.description: The client was uncomfortable when the process narrowed to a single finalist without a ready backup, creating perceived risk if the finalist fell through. Continuing to surface candidates until offer acceptance and background checks are complete would strengthen confidence and reduce time-to-recover.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I was not quite comfortable that we had a ready backup pool... other search firms... keep sharing candidates... until an offer is accepted [and] background checks been cleared"
opportunities.suggestedAction: Adopt a consistent “pipeline continuity” standard: keep presenting qualified candidates (or maintain warm alternates) through offer acceptance and clearance milestones.

opportunities.title: Proactive notifications for assessment result delivery
opportunities.description: Assessment insights were highly valued, but the rollout caused delays because results were sent to a dedicated mailbox without a proactive heads-up. A simple notification and confirmation loop would reduce friction and prevent missed deliverables.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "there also wasn't any communication... that said, heads up, they're going to start going out to you now... that sort of proactive nudge... was missing"
opportunities.suggestedAction: Add an automated and/or consultant-sent alert when assessments are released (where sent, what to expect, and a confirmation check within 24 hours).

opportunities.title: Secure rehire by confirming refinements upfront
opportunities.description: Andre explicitly stated willingness to rehire Korn Ferry, contingent on clearer communication expectations and responsiveness. This is a near-term opportunity to lock in future search work by proactively addressing the stated conditions.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "If we had search to do over again, I would rehire them, as long as we did some early setting of communication preferences, timeliness of responses"
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a short post-search debrief to agree the communication playbook and pipeline approach, and document it as the default for OCC going forward.

opportunities.title: Expand from assessments into more executive searches
opportunities.description: OCC already uses Korn Ferry broadly for assessments, leadership behaviors, 360 feedback, and development, and the search outcome was positive with strong candidate quality. This creates a clear path to expand search scope beyond the Controller role into additional confidential or leadership hires.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "we've worked with them... primarily in our assessment and organizational development functions... we use them for pre hire assessments... deliver 360 feedback and other... development opportunities" and "I would rehire them"
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a forward-looking hiring roadmap session to identify upcoming leadership roles where Korn Ferry can run search plus assessment as an integrated solution.

opportunities.title: Ongoing leadership development and 360 programs
opportunities.description: The client indicates continued use of leadership behaviors work, pre-hire assessments, 360 feedback, and ongoing development offerings. These are recurring needs that can be formalized into an annual plan or programmatic engagement.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "They've been partners to us in developing our list of leadership behaviors... partnered with them to deliver 360 feedback and other sort of ongoing development opportunities"
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an annual assessment-and-development calendar (360s, coaching, leadership behavior refresh) with agreed timelines and points of contact.

opportunities.title: Package role-shaping advisory into future searches
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry’s market insight and CPA credibility helped reframe the role and expand the talent pool, which the client found additive. This advisory component can be positioned as a standard value-add for future searches and workforce planning.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "As Anne's a CPA... you're calling this X, this is how it looks in the market... [it] opened up the pool of talent"
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a repeatable “role calibration + market mapping” module at the start of searches and offer it to OCC for upcoming roles.

opportunities.title: Rebuild trust after difficult first engagement
opportunities.description: The client described the engagement as difficult and indicated Korn Ferry would not be a top choice for future work. A proactive recovery plan could prevent churn and reopen consideration for future searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “this first engagement was a difficult experience and would be hesitant to use Korn Ferry again” and “would not... be on top of the list to call”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule an executive-level debrief with Shannon to acknowledge issues, share corrective actions, and agree on a reset plan for any future needs.

opportunities.title: Align to governance and communication pathways
opportunities.description: The consultant bypassed the agreed recruitment policy by going directly to the Board Chair, which changed timelines and undermined the internal committee’s role. Clear governance mapping and adherence would reduce friction and rebuild confidence.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “twice when he went to him, he got time frames changed and meetings changed, and that not would not have happened had the internal group been able to have the conversation with our board members.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: At kickoff, document and get sign-off on a governance/communications protocol (who can change timelines, who is the single point of contact) and enforce it throughout the search.

opportunities.title: Act faster on client feedback and direction
opportunities.description: The client had to repeat feedback before it was implemented, especially around narrowing the candidate slate. Improving responsiveness would signal listening and reduce frustration.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It took me calling him twice to get that to stop.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a feedback-to-action cadence (e.g., 24–48 hour turnaround with written confirmation of changes) and a weekly alignment check-in.

opportunities.title: Improve candidate fit against association needs
opportunities.description: Candidates were advanced despite clear feedback they did not match the role’s core requirements (e.g., mediator/consensus builder), which eroded confidence in Korn Ferry’s judgment and alignment.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “we were really looking for that person that could be a mediator... And so she was an immediate no... And Charlie was like, Well, I don't understand this. Why would you not consider her?”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Recalibrate the success profile with explicit ‘must-have’ behaviors (e.g., mediation/coalition-building) and add a stricter internal screening gate before presenting candidates.

opportunities.title: Shift from volume outreach to targeted slate
opportunities.description: The client wanted a small number of high-quality benchmark candidates given a strong internal contender, but experienced the search as volume-driven. A targeted approach would better match expectations and reduce reputational/political risk.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It felt more like he was trying to get us bodies... we need two or three people... this is the bar. They got to be as good as our internal candidate, or better.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Agree upfront on slate size and benchmarking intent (e.g., 2–3 external finalists) and run a targeted sourcing plan with client-approved target lists.

opportunities.title: Tighten compensation alignment and screening
opportunities.description: At least one candidate was far outside the disclosed compensation range, indicating misalignment in screening and potentially wasting stakeholder time. Stronger compensation calibration would improve efficiency and credibility.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “He brought us someone who... was well over a million dollars in salary, and he knew ours was like at 600, 700,000 total.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Add a mandatory compensation-range checkpoint before candidate submission and confirm candidate expectations in writing prior to presenting.

opportunities.title: Use association-experienced consultants for governance nuance
opportunities.description: The consultant struggled with the operational and governance dynamics of a membership-driven association, contributing to missteps with board/committee interactions and candidate evaluation. Deploying sector-specialized leadership would improve outcomes.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Limited association understanding... struggled to fully grasp the unique operational and governance model of associations, where both board and members play central roles.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Assign an association-sector lead (or add a governance-savvy co-lead) for future work and incorporate an association-governance briefing into the kickoff.

opportunities.title: Reassess assessment tool value and timing
opportunities.description: The assessment was perceived as adding little value given the clear strength of the internal candidate. Better tailoring when and how assessments are used could improve perceived ROI.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “The provided assessment added little value in this search, as the internal candidate was clearly the strongest option.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Align on decision points for assessment use (e.g., only for finalists or internal/external comparisons) and explain how results will influence board decisions.

opportunities.title: Future executive search support for association roles
opportunities.description: Although hesitant now, the client may need future senior searches and previously selected Korn Ferry due to association-sector credibility. Maintaining a relationship and demonstrating improvements could position Korn Ferry for the next opportunity.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Korn Ferry was chosen based on prior association-sector experience... but Shannon noted they “would not... be on top of the list to call” right now for future searches.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Maintain light-touch engagement (quarterly check-ins, sector insights) and offer a no-cost governance/search process review to be considered for the next role.

opportunities.title: Offer governance-aligned search process redesign
opportunities.description: The core friction centered on governance, decision rights, and communication pathways between committee and board chair. Korn Ferry can expand value by providing a structured governance-aligned search playbook tailored to associations.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Bypassing agreed governance... overriding the recruitment policy” and “Governance alignment was critical.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a short consulting engagement to map decision rights, stakeholder roles, and escalation paths for future searches within WSPA’s association governance model.

opportunities.title: Align assessment approach upfront to avoid overlap
opportunities.description: Cargill has an intensive internal assessment process, and Korn Ferry’s automatic 30-minute assessment created friction due to duplication. A clearer early conversation would prevent wasted time and candidate fatigue.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “make sure you have a very clear conversation with your client about your assessment, whether they have one, and whether it makes sense to do both… upfront.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Add an explicit assessment-alignment step in kickoff (client assessment map, decision on KF assessment, and documented rationale) before candidate outreach.

opportunities.title: Maintain broader pipeline visibility through late stages
opportunities.description: The search briefly felt overly dependent on a single finalist, creating stakeholder stress about having sufficient options. Ensuring a consistently broad-looking slate and communicating pipeline depth would increase confidence.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “There was some stress at one point that… are we putting all our eggs in one basket… at the 11th hour, Korn Ferry pulled a rabbit out of their hat.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a pipeline coverage plan (e.g., minimum viable shortlist/backup candidates) and provide weekly pipeline dashboards showing active prospects, readiness, and risks.

opportunities.title: Proactively reinforce trusted-partner status across searches
opportunities.description: Cargill does not use Korn Ferry exclusively, even though they view Korn Ferry as a trusted, high-performing partner. Proactive relationship management can help protect share-of-wallet and keep Korn Ferry top-of-mind for upcoming senior roles.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “While they do not use Korn Ferry exclusively, they view them as a trusted partner who consistently delivers high-quality results.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a quarterly talent/recruiting strategy check-in with Michael to review upcoming leadership needs, lessons learned, and where Korn Ferry can lead vs. support.

opportunities.title: Leverage performance audit to win more search volume
opportunities.description: Michael’s five-year audit indicates Korn Ferry outperforms other firms on outcomes like retention and diversity, which is strong proof to justify allocating more searches to Korn Ferry. This can be used to expand engagement beyond ad-hoc selection among multiple firms.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I did a five-year audit… their performance is the best compared to the three that we work with regularly.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a preferred-partner or tiered allocation model using the audit data, with agreed success metrics and a target increase in annual search assignments.

opportunities.title: Ongoing senior finance leadership searches likely
opportunities.description: Cargill values Korn Ferry’s ability to access and engage top-tier CAO-level talent and provide expert process guidance, suggesting future needs for similar senior finance/accounting leadership roles. Maintaining market mapping and readiness will support faster future searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “you should know who the Fortune 100, Fortune 200 CAOs are… You should be able to get some of them to the table” and “worked with Korn Ferry on several senior searches.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an annual/biannual CAO/CFO succession and market-mapping refresh for Cargill to keep target lists warm and shorten time-to-slate for future roles.

opportunities.title: Set clear response-time and update cadence
opportunities.description: The client experienced slow email responses and wanted more frequent interim updates to maintain confidence and reassure stakeholders. Establishing explicit SLAs and a predictable communication rhythm would reduce frustration and prevent misinterpretations of disengagement.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Sometimes it took 30 hours or so... you would have thought at least one of them could just tell me... but [we got nothing]” and a desire for “quicker interim updates to reassure stakeholders.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Agree and document response SLAs and a weekly (or twice-weekly) progress update cadence at kickoff, including who covers inbox/queries when the lead is unavailable.

opportunities.title: Share early draft profiles to guide direction
opportunities.description: They valued quality but wanted earlier visibility of initial profiles to give feedback and confirm the search was on track, rather than waiting weeks for a polished shortlist. Earlier “directional” profiles would increase speed and stakeholder confidence without sacrificing quality.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It would have been better to just get...the first profile to work with...and tell them [yes] that's going in the right direction.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce an early-market calibration step (e.g., 3–5 draft profiles or target list within the first 7–10 days) to validate criteria and adjust quickly.

opportunities.title: Increase flexibility versus standard procedure rigidity
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry’s structured methodology was respected but sometimes felt slower and less pragmatic than boutique firms. More flexibility in process steps and deliverable timing would better match the client’s working style.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I sometimes [had] the impression they really need[ed] to follow their standard procedure... sometimes I would have liked them to be a bit more...flexible.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a tailored project plan at kickoff with optional “fast-track” variants (e.g., parallel referencing, earlier stakeholder check-ins, lighter initial documentation) while maintaining quality controls.

opportunities.title: Repair CFO’s early disengagement perception
opportunities.description: The CFO initially felt Korn Ferry did not want the assignment and questioned responsiveness/engagement, which could affect future selection decisions. Proactive senior-level outreach can rebuild confidence and prevent the issue from resurfacing.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “In the very beginning [the CFO] really had the impression they didn't want to do the job... it was too low level for them.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a brief debrief with Dr. Nina and the CFO led by the partner to acknowledge the early experience, share what will change (SLAs/early profiles), and reaffirm commitment.

opportunities.title: Align compensation expectations earlier in process
opportunities.description: A strong candidate progressed with compensation expectations far beyond what the client would pay, creating wasted effort and risk of late-stage fallout. Earlier, explicit compensation alignment would improve efficiency and candidate transparency.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It makes sense to talk about packages early in the process” and a candidate had “a package far beyond what we were able to or willing to pay.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Add a mandatory early compensation/total package alignment checkpoint (with documented range confirmation) before advancing candidates to later stages.

opportunities.title: Use secure shared drive for profile sharing
opportunities.description: The client preferred not to receive candidate profiles by email and requested a shared drive approach for better data security and cleanup after the search. Updating the document-sharing method would improve trust and client experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I didn't want to have any profiles in my inbox... [I'd rather you] share your drive... once the search is finished, I'm going to close the drive.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Default to a client-approved secure workspace (shared drive/portal) for all candidate materials and agree retention/closure steps at project start.

opportunities.title: Leverage prior success to secure repeat searches
opportunities.description: They stated they would use Korn Ferry again and were happy with the outcome, indicating strong potential for repeat executive search work. Formalizing a forward-looking relationship plan can convert satisfaction into pipeline.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Yes, absolutely [would use them again]... I'm really happy with the result.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a quarterly talent/leadership hiring outlook check-in with HR and the CPO to identify upcoming roles early and reserve capacity.

opportunities.title: Ongoing stakeholder reassurance during future searches
opportunities.description: They highlighted the need for interim updates to reassure stakeholders, suggesting future searches will require more visible momentum reporting. This is a recurring support need, especially with senior stakeholders like the CFO.
opportunities.supportingQuote: A desire for “quicker interim updates to reassure stakeholders” and tension from “waiting period.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a lightweight stakeholder update pack (weekly progress, market signals, next steps) and agree distribution to key stakeholders for future assignments.

opportunities.title: Add stronger QA for presentation materials
opportunities.description: Occasional calculation/formula mistakes in deliverables undermine confidence even in an otherwise trusted relationship. A tighter quality-control process would reduce errors before materials reach the committee.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "there are times where I have found mistakes... It could be a certain formula wasn't used properly. Or...something that's not the median..."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a two-step QA review (analyst + senior reviewer) for all benchmarking and committee decks, with a pre-send checklist for formulas/medians.

opportunities.title: Broaden services as DLH grows
opportunities.description: Stephen indicated openness to using Korn Ferry more broadly as the company matures. This is a clear opening to expand beyond the current compensation committee retainer into adjacent governance and talent offerings.
opportunities.supportingQuote: He "would consider using them more broadly as DLH Holdings grows."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a growth-aligned roadmap of additional services (e.g., broader board/governance advisory, executive pay strategy, leadership assessment) timed to DLH’s maturity milestones.

opportunities.title: Advisory on AI impact to skills and pay
opportunities.description: Stephen is actively thinking about how AI will change workforce development and compensation structures, signaling a future need for guidance. Korn Ferry can position thought leadership and advisory support at the intersection of AI, talent, and rewards.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "AI awareness is something always on my mind… it’s confusing, but it’s changing how younger generations develop within the workforce."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an executive briefing/workshop on AI-driven workforce and rewards implications, followed by an optional diagnostic on skills, job architecture, and pay structures.

opportunities.title: Reinforce value after competitive pricing pressure
opportunities.description: They recently ran a competitive review where other firms were ~30% cheaper, so continued reinforcement of value and differentiation is important to protect the retainer. Proactive check-ins can prevent price-driven reconsideration and keep the partnership strong.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "so and so is offering 30% less than what you are... we consider price but... we consider the quality of the relationship"
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a semi-annual value review summarizing outcomes, responsiveness metrics, and specialist expertise delivered, and align on priorities for the next 6–12 months.

opportunities.title: Leverage advocacy and introductions for referrals
opportunities.description: Stephen has already introduced Korn Ferry to peers, indicating strong advocacy that can be converted into a structured referral pipeline. Formalizing this can deepen the relationship and generate new opportunities.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I have introduced them to people I know who are in the private sector... two or three times. I've made introductions..."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Ask permission to formalize referrals (target list + warm-intro plan) and provide Stephen with a short, tailored capabilities deck he can forward to peers.

opportunities.title: Standardize earlier candidate report delivery timelines
opportunities.description: The first candidate report arrived too close to the interview, reducing the client’s preparation time. Making earlier delivery a standard expectation would prevent recurrence and improve consistency across searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They sent the first candidate report...48 hours before the interview...I told them that this was too short”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set and agree a minimum lead time SLA for candidate reports (e.g., 5 business days pre-interview) and bake it into the search project plan.

opportunities.title: Ensure consistent completeness of candidate reports
opportunities.description: An early report missed specific details needed for interviews, even though it was corrected later. A quality-control step would ensure every report includes the required information from the start.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “There was also some information missing... but they were very reactive and adapted it for the next reports.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce a standardized report checklist aligned to the client’s interview needs and run an internal QA review before sending.

opportunities.title: Post-placement follow-up and onboarding check-ins
opportunities.description: The client explicitly wants structured follow-up with the placed candidate after start to confirm integration and share feedback back to HR. This is a clear future support need that can be productized as part of executive search delivery.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I really hope that they will do a follow up...when she's been here for a few weeks and then maybe within three or six months....Give her a call...and then give me the feedback because that's really valuable for me”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule and deliver a formal post-placement cadence (e.g., 2–4 weeks, 3 months, 6 months) with documented feedback to client and candidate.

opportunities.title: Position Korn Ferry for future executive-level searches
opportunities.description: Vanessa indicates strong intent to reuse Korn Ferry for ExCo/general management roles, where premium fees are justified. This creates an opportunity to secure preferred-partner status for senior mandates in Benelux.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “For ExCo positions, yes.” / “If I had to do this again…I would work with Korn Ferry definitely”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively map upcoming ExCo/GM succession needs and agree a forward-looking plan for senior searches (including confidentiality approach and timelines).

opportunities.title: Reinforce partnership via proactive follow-up touchpoints
opportunities.description: The client values relationship continuity and explicitly asks for follow-up; acting on this will strengthen the partnership and keep Korn Ferry top-of-mind for the next senior mandate. Without proactive touchpoints, the relationship may remain transactional and limited to occasional searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Part of it is indeed the trust I have in Olivier Top as a consultant” and “I really hope that they will do a follow up...”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set quarterly relationship check-ins with Vanessa (separate from active searches) and include a post-placement review as a standard agenda item.

opportunities.title: Offer cost-calibrated options for non-ExCo roles
opportunities.description: She would likely use other firms for less senior hires due to Korn Ferry’s higher fees, limiting share of wallet. A tiered or scoped offering could capture additional roles while preserving premium positioning for top mandates.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “For other positions, no, because actually their fees are higher than all the other headhunters in Belgium.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a differentiated delivery model for sub-ExCo roles (e.g., lighter-touch search, fixed-fee, or hybrid RPO/search) while keeping full executive search for top roles.

opportunities.title: Clarify broader Korn Ferry capabilities without pushing
opportunities.description: Vanessa currently views Korn Ferry primarily as a headhunting firm and notes existing leadership/HR partnerships and group-level control over benchmarks. A light, consultative clarification can prevent missed opportunities while respecting her stated constraints.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Not really because I think their core business is headhunting…we have a partnership…expert in leadership…I know they also do salary benchmarks…these…would be decided by our group in Germany”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Share a concise capability overview tailored to Benelux needs (e.g., assessments tied to search, onboarding support) and ask where local discretion exists versus group-controlled decisions.

opportunities.title: Ongoing ELT and strategic role searches
opportunities.description: PartnerRe will continue to use external search firms for ELT and other strategic roles that cannot be filled through succession, especially amid leadership changes and reshuffles.
opportunities.supportingQuote: They partner with external search firms for ELT and key strategic roles that cannot be filled through succession.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively map likely upcoming critical roles with Lisa/CEO and propose a forward-looking search roadmap and timelines.

opportunities.title: Expand leader profiling and benchmarking support
opportunities.description: Lisa is already using Korn Ferry leader profiles and benchmark/data and signals openness to drawing on more of Korn Ferry’s broader expertise when needs arise.
opportunities.supportingQuote: We've done a number of the leader profiles... having conversations around benchmark... I've used their data for other things as well... I actually need something in this area, have you got something that would help.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a packaged quarterly talent/leadership insights session combining leader profiles, benchmarking, and targeted recommendations for current priorities.

opportunities.title: Increase share of wallet despite non-exclusivity
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry is one of three firms and the relationship is non-exclusive, but Korn Ferry has been winning most tenders—creating an opportunity to formalize preferred-partner status or secure more mandates.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Korn Ferry is one of three partners... the relationship remains non-exclusive... [tenders] heavily weighted towards Korn Ferry.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a preferred supplier framework (service levels, pricing bands, and governance) to convert strong performance into more consistent mandate flow.

opportunities.title: Improve listening balance on US-led searches
opportunities.description: Lisa noted that on a US-based search, consultants sometimes over-talk; improving listening and local sensitivity would strengthen delivery and stakeholder confidence.
opportunities.supportingQuote: There's probably a little bit more listening needed on the US side... sometimes... you can over-talk... just that opportunity really, really just listen.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Coach the US search team on listening-first behaviors and build structured stakeholder listening checkpoints into the search process.

opportunities.title: Strengthen multi-region team communication and coordination
opportunities.description: When multiple teams/regions are involved, coordination and communication can slip; tightening governance would reduce friction and improve client experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: [There's] an opportunity to work on communication when there are multiple teams around the table.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Assign a single engagement coordinator and implement a clear RACI, shared tracker, and agreed cadence for cross-region updates.

opportunities.title: Fix short-notice scheduling and diary management
opportunities.description: There were issues getting interviews/meetings scheduled last minute for a stakeholder not led by Lisa; improving scheduling discipline would prevent avoidable frustration.
opportunities.supportingQuote: There's been some [difficulty] trying to get meetings in the diary... or interviews... last minute, which is never going to work for her.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set scheduling SLAs (minimum notice periods, scheduling owner, and escalation path) at kickoff and use a shared scheduling plan for all stakeholders.

opportunities.title: Apply learnings consistently across repeat mandates
opportunities.description: Lisa implied that in repeat or sensitive searches, Korn Ferry should carry forward prior learnings more consistently to avoid enthusiasm being perceived as over-talking.
opportunities.supportingQuote: In a search previously managed by another firm... consultants' enthusiasm occasionally came across as over-talking when Lisa saw scope to apply learnings.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a short 'client preferences and lessons learned' brief for PartnerRe and require all consultants on the account to review it before stakeholder meetings.

opportunities.title: Increase post-placement check-ins to reduce risk
opportunities.description: Challenging searches and a candidate withdrawal indicate a need to reinforce post-offer and post-start engagement to protect outcomes and strengthen trust.
opportunities.supportingQuote: We've had some challenging searches... we've had one that's pulled out... Monitor post-placement phase. Ensure early check-ins with placed candidates and hiring leaders.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a standard post-offer and 30/60/90-day check-in plan with both candidate and hiring leaders, with rapid escalation if risk signals appear.

opportunities.title: Standardize delivery quality across all search teams
opportunities.description: The client experiences variability in engagement and effectiveness when searches are led by consultants outside Jerry’s core team. Creating consistent ways of working would protect the strong brand experience and reduce reliance on a single relationship lead.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I wasn't as impressed... it depends on the team that you're working with."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a consistent delivery playbook (cadence, stakeholder updates, candidate management standards) and ensure every Macquarie search has a senior oversight/check-in to maintain Jerry-level quality.

opportunities.title: Reduce key-person dependency on Jerry relationship
opportunities.description: The partnership is highly anchored to Jerry; when other consultants led, engagement dropped until Jerry took over. This creates continuity risk if Jerry is unavailable and signals a need to broaden trusted touchpoints.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Jerry took over and we were able to move the process along pretty quickly."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a named account bench (primary + deputy leads) and run periodic joint check-ins so Cana builds confidence in multiple Korn Ferry leaders.

opportunities.title: Provide periodic compensation and benchmarking insights
opportunities.description: Cana expressed interest in receiving light-touch, periodic compensation benchmarking similar to what they received from another firm. This indicates an ongoing advisory need beyond individual searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "if we could get more comp benchmarking surveys... they would send us an annual comp report which was helpful."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an annual (or semi-annual) compensation/market benchmarking pack tailored to private markets roles, with a short readout session for HR and key hiring leaders.

opportunities.title: Expand into DEI support for senior hiring
opportunities.description: DEI is a stated HR priority, especially increasing diverse representation in senior roles. Korn Ferry can deepen the relationship by adding structured DEI sourcing, slate goals, and inclusive assessment practices to searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Key HR priorities include: "Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: increasing diverse representation in senior hiring."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a DEI-enhanced search approach (diverse pipeline mapping, inclusive scorecards, and progress reporting) for upcoming senior MD and executive searches.

opportunities.title: Support digital and AI capability hiring strategy
opportunities.description: Macquarie is prioritizing digital and AI integration and data-led decision-making, which may require new leadership profiles and scarce-skill talent mapping. Korn Ferry can extend from search execution into workforce and capability advisory for these areas.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Key HR priorities include: "Digital and AI integration: expanding technological capability and data-led decision-making across the business."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a targeted market map and role/competency framework for digital/AI leadership and critical hires within private markets and adjacent investment teams.

opportunities.title: Talent development for new growth areas
opportunities.description: The business is moving into new growth areas (private equity adjacencies and entrepreneurial fund structures), implying future needs for new role design, leadership assessment, and succession planning. This is an opportunity to support beyond immediate searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Key HR priorities include: "Talent development for new growth areas: including private equity adjacencies and entrepreneurial fund structures."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Initiate a discovery session on upcoming growth-area talent needs and propose a phased plan covering role architecture, assessment, and succession/leadership development.

opportunities.title: Maintain proactive post-placement follow-up consistently
opportunities.description: The client values that Korn Ferry stays in touch with placed candidates and can advise on onboarding, but this should be consistently executed across all teams. Formalizing post-placement touchpoints would strengthen outcomes and retention.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I think you know they do stay in touch [with placed candidates] ...they can also give the hires advice on how to best on board into Macquarie and be successful."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Standardize a post-placement plan (e.g., 30/60/90-day check-ins with candidate and hiring manager) and share a brief onboarding success guide tailored to Macquarie.

opportunities.title: Offer forensic referencing as an optional add-on
opportunities.description: They have used Korn Ferry for forensic referencing when requested by hiring managers, despite it not being Cana’s preference. Packaging this as an optional, clearly scoped add-on could increase value while aligning to stakeholder needs.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "when the hiring manager wanted it, we’ve done it a few times."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a clear forensic referencing option (when to use, turnaround time, outputs) and socialize it with HR and hiring managers as an on-demand service.

opportunities.title: Resource early-stage mapping and research better
opportunities.description: Early-stage market mapping and research arrived later than expected and appeared under-resourced, which extended the search timeline. Improving research capacity and timing would increase speed and reduce reliance on the lead consultant to cover gaps.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "We mapped out all private equity firms... I felt like this came slightly later in the search than it should have... it felt like Dan had to pull the weight."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Assign stronger research support upfront with clear mapping milestones and QA checks in week 1–2 of the search.

opportunities.title: Standardize search operations and tracking
opportunities.description: The client expected stronger “run of the mill” search operations (candidate tracking, benchmarking) to keep the process efficient. More consistent operational rigor would reduce delays and improve predictability.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I would expect [Korn Ferry] to just [do a] slightly better job at run of the mill skilled operations, like mapping out candidate tracking... benchmarking."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a standardized search ops playbook (tracking templates, benchmarking outputs, weekly status reporting) used across all engagements.

opportunities.title: Improve consistency beyond the lead consultant
opportunities.description: Mike’s positive experience was driven primarily by Dan, while other team contributions felt average, creating risk that future engagements may not meet the same standard. Consistency across teams would protect the relationship and brand perception.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I didn't feel like I was working exactly with Korn Ferry... I'm not sure that's endemic of Korn Ferry... the junior research analyst was average at best."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce tighter team selection, training, and internal QA so delivery quality is consistent regardless of the individual consultant.

opportunities.title: Rework assessment outputs for actionable insight
opportunities.description: Assessment results were perceived as slow and lacking the specific comparative insights requested (peers, upward comparisons), and less candid/actionable than competitor outputs. Enhancing assessment design and tailoring would increase perceived value and differentiation.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "It took a long time and the insights were lacking... [I asked] specifically [for] data on peers, data on up... [but they] didn't do what was instructed."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Redesign assessment deliverables to explicitly answer agreed questions (peer/up comparisons, performance risks, team dynamics) with clearer, more candid recommendations and faster turnaround SLAs.

opportunities.title: Benchmark assessments against competitor 'Pebble'
opportunities.description: Mike explicitly compared Korn Ferry’s assessment experience unfavorably to Pebble’s clarity and practicality. Using this as a benchmark can guide improvements in candour, relevance, and actionability.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Pebble were very clear... it's useful information to have, and it's actionable."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Conduct a competitive review of Pebble-style outputs and incorporate best practices into Korn Ferry’s assessment reporting and debrief approach.

opportunities.title: Improve KF4D usability and insight retrieval
opportunities.description: KF4D was described as information-rich but difficult to navigate, limiting the client’s ability to extract value quickly. Better UX and guided summaries would increase adoption and satisfaction.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "KF4D... has a treasure trove of valuable information... it's incredibly hard to get out."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Provide a simplified client-facing view (dashboards/summaries) and a short enablement session to help clients find key insights quickly.

opportunities.title: Extend assessment interpretation and advisory support
opportunities.description: Mike valued the added step of connecting with an assessment expert to interpret results, suggesting appetite for deeper advisory around assessment insights. This can be packaged as a premium debrief/coaching offering for hiring teams.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "He connected me with the individual who runs those assessments... he explained the profile... showed what was worth looking at... that was super helpful."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a structured assessment debrief package (expert-led readout + hiring decision workshop) as an add-on for future searches.

opportunities.title: Ongoing executive searches across portfolio lifecycle
opportunities.description: Mike supports portfolio companies across the investment lifecycle, implying recurring leadership and specialist hiring needs as portfolios evolve. Korn Ferry can position itself as a repeat partner for future portfolio searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Mike supports portfolio companies in enterprise technology, product innovation, and software engineering "throughout the investment lifecycle."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively propose a portfolio talent roadmap and a repeatable search model for technology/product leadership roles across Inflexion’s portfolio.

opportunities.title: Protect relationship from brand-consistency risk
opportunities.description: The client’s loyalty is strongly tied to Dan rather than Korn Ferry overall, creating retention risk if Dan is unavailable or team composition changes. A deliberate relationship plan can anchor trust in the broader firm.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Mike’s experience was shaped primarily by Dan’s personal approach rather than the Korn Ferry brand; "I didn't get to experience Korn Ferry beyond them in the search."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule an executive check-in with a senior Korn Ferry leader to reinforce firm-wide commitment, introduce a consistent delivery team, and agree service standards for future work.

opportunities.title: Expand beyond finance into broader functions
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry is heavily used for finance searches, while other parts of IVC use Korn Ferry for CEO/general management roles. There is an opportunity to formalize and broaden coverage across additional functions and business units.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I use them extensively for finance...but there are other parts of the organization [that] use Korn Ferry for CEO, general management type roles.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Map current usage by function and propose a cross-functional executive search partnership plan with named leads for each major stakeholder group.

opportunities.title: Potential future leadership development support
opportunities.description: Leadership development is currently delivered in-house due to budget constraints, but Briony has had very positive prior experience with Korn Ferry’s development offering. This suggests future demand if budget priorities shift or if a targeted, lower-cost program is proposed.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Leadership development is delivered in-house at IVC due to budget priorities, though Briony previously had an excellent experience with Korn Ferry’s development offering.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a modular, budget-sensitive leadership development option (e.g., targeted assessments + coaching for critical leaders) timed to their planning/budget cycle.

opportunities.title: Bundle assessments and compensation intelligence more explicitly
opportunities.description: Briony values Korn Ferry’s inclusion of assessments and compensation intelligence as differentiators versus competitors who charge extra. Packaging these elements as a standard, clearly articulated value proposition could help win more searches and increase share of wallet.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I find for some of these key C suite roles...it's the basic thing nowadays...I do appreciate that side of and also to the comp Intel as well.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a concise ‘what’s included’ executive search pack highlighting assessments, comp intel, and referencing as standard and socialize it with other IVC stakeholders.

opportunities.title: Proactively reinforce value after multiple searches
opportunities.description: They have completed four searches in 12 months and Briony explicitly asks for consideration on repeat business. This is a signal to proactively strengthen the partnership with a structured review and commercial approach to retain preference.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “this is our fourth search in 12 months, ‘what can you do for me?’ she takes that on board.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a quarterly partnership review and propose a repeat-search commercial framework (e.g., volume-based fee flexibility or added-value services).

opportunities.title: Offer flexible portal vs high-touch communication options
opportunities.description: Briony notes that portals can be efficient for some leaders but not suitable for others who prefer email reports and phone feedback. Providing stakeholder-specific workflow options would improve experience and reduce friction across different leader preferences.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “some...will very happily log into a portal...but there are some stakeholders who are used to getting a report sent through on email, feedback on a phone call…so...depends on the stakeholders.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a ‘communication and reporting preferences’ kickoff step per search, offering both portal-based and high-touch (email/call) reporting tracks by stakeholder.

opportunities.title: Formalize stakeholder communication and update cadence
opportunities.description: The search involved multiple stakeholders, but there was no agreed communication structure, creating potential inefficiency and reliance on ad hoc outreach. Establishing a clear cadence and points of contact would streamline coordination and reduce friction in future engagements.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “we didn't really talk about a formal communication process...they didn't necessarily have a point person...Perhaps an efficiency would be for me to understand who do you want me to connect with on your side”
opportunities.suggestedAction: At kickoff, agree a communication plan (single client POC(s), KF POC(s), escalation path, and weekly/biweekly update rhythm) and document it in writing.

opportunities.title: Add performance metrics to candidate profiles
opportunities.description: The client valued additional quantitative context (e.g., market cap, TSR) to compare candidates across different scales and industries. Including these metrics would strengthen decision-making and reduce dependence on informal market knowledge.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Perhaps seeing some TSR during the 10 years for the CEO candidates and CFF candidates...it is important to see what were the results” and “we did add it to our profiles...I don't think we had market cap in there originally”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Standardize candidate profile templates to include relevant scale/performance indicators (e.g., market cap, revenue, TSR where applicable) with clear sourcing and time horizons.

opportunities.title: Reduce reliance on single consultant for continuity
opportunities.description: The relationship is strongly tied to Jane’s personal network and responsiveness, which the client implicitly flagged as a continuity risk. Broadening visibility of the broader team and codifying knowledge would protect the partnership if staffing changes occur.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Reliance on Jane's personal network noted as a potential continuity consideration” and “I always use Jane as my point of contact”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce a named deputy/bench lead and ensure shared documentation (market maps, candidate intel, decision rationale) is accessible to the broader Korn Ferry team.

opportunities.title: Extend board advisory using board matrix approach
opportunities.description: The client found the tailored board matrix especially helpful for visualizing end-state composition and gaps. This can be expanded into ongoing board effectiveness, refreshment planning, and committee/skills evolution advisory beyond individual searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “a matrix...a little more in depth to see here's what the end state looks like, and what gaps do we have to fill...So that was really helpful”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose an annual/biannual board composition and succession planning workshop leveraging the matrix to guide refreshment and committee planning.

opportunities.title: Support CEO succession and leadership transitions
opportunities.description: IFF has already re-engaged Korn Ferry for CEO succession work, indicating an ongoing need for senior leadership succession planning and related governance support. This suggests continued demand for executive succession, assessment, and transition planning services.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Korn Ferry has since been re-engaged for CEO succession work” and “We also did a bit of an RFP on CEO succession...and did select [them]”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Align on a CEO succession roadmap (timeline, stakeholder governance, candidate benchmarking/assessment options, and communications plan) and confirm next milestones.

opportunities.title: Broaden use of assessment and benchmarking tools
opportunities.description: No assessment or benchmarking tools were used in the board searches, yet the client values structured, data-backed evaluation (e.g., TSR/scale metrics). Introducing Korn Ferry’s assessment/benchmarking capabilities could deepen rigor for CEO succession and future board/exec decisions.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “While no assessment or benchmarking tools were used for these board searches” and interest in “seeing some TSR” / “market cap”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an optional assessment/benchmarking module for CEO succession and key board roles, explaining how it complements network-based referencing and background checks.

opportunities.title: Future board hiring when stability changes
opportunities.description: While there are no immediate hiring needs, future board or executive search support may be required if the currently stable board composition changes or new priorities emerge.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “At present, the board is stable with no immediate hiring needs.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a light-touch check-in cadence (e.g., semi-annual) to monitor upcoming succession or new role needs and stay top-of-mind.

opportunities.title: Governance and structural change advisory support
opportunities.description: The client is actively discussing governance and structural change, which may create demand for advisory support (e.g., board effectiveness, operating model, governance design).
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Discussions focus on governance, structural change, and ongoing portfolio matters.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a targeted governance/structure workshop or diagnostic aligned to the board’s current agenda and propose a short advisory engagement.

opportunities.title: Portfolio and succession planning support
opportunities.description: Ongoing portfolio matters suggest potential future needs around leadership succession, talent mapping, and scenario planning as the portfolio evolves.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Discussions focus on governance, structural change, and ongoing portfolio matters.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a portfolio talent map and succession risk review to anticipate leadership needs before roles become urgent.

opportunities.title: Expand from search into executive assessment
opportunities.description: Kristin has prior positive experience with Korn Ferry assessments, creating a natural path to expand beyond search into assessment for board/leadership evaluation and development.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Kristin had also been assessed by Korn Ferry several times as an executive.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Recommend an assessment-based board/leadership effectiveness or succession readiness program leveraging Korn Ferry’s assessment capability.

opportunities.title: Broaden relationships across HR and board stakeholders
opportunities.description: Multiple stakeholders (HR director, board, nomination committee) were highly satisfied, creating an opportunity to deepen multi-threaded relationships and increase repeat engagements.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “the HR director...[was] incredibly happy” and “unanimous positive feedback from the board, HR, and nomination committee.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule stakeholder debriefs with HR and nomination committee members to capture upcoming priorities and position Korn Ferry for future work.

opportunities.title: Leverage trusted consultants for regional needs
opportunities.description: Kristin explicitly values specific consultants (Mette, Phoebe, Stieg) and sees Stieg as strong in the Norwegian market, suggesting an opportunity to expand into regional or market-specific searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “she has a colleague called Stieg...I see him as a Norwegian market type of person. He's really good there.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively share a regional market outlook and offer support for any Norway/Nordics leadership needs using the trusted team.

opportunities.title: Maintain momentum despite no immediate hiring
opportunities.description: With no near-term requisitions, there is a risk the relationship goes dormant; maintaining engagement will protect future share-of-wallet when needs arise.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “At present, the board is stable with no immediate hiring needs.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a relationship plan with periodic value-add touchpoints (market insights, governance trends, succession check-ins) to stay engaged.

opportunities.title: Ensure consistent quality across supporting team
opportunities.description: Although the experience was excellent, the client’s trust is strongly tied to specific individuals; ensuring consistent delivery across the broader team reduces key-person dependency risk.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “it has quite a lot to do with the individual...she knows me” and “I'm very happy with the team, Mette...but also Phoebe.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Document client preferences and success factors in an account playbook and ensure continuity planning across consultants for future searches.

opportunities.title: Prevent missed updates to avoid blindsiding
opportunities.description: There was one instance where Fiona felt blindsided due to a missed update. While it was resolved quickly, tightening update discipline would protect the consistently strong communication experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I've just had one occasion where I was blindsided."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a simple communication SLA (e.g., stakeholder touchpoints and update cadence) and a backup owner to ensure no updates are missed.

opportunities.title: Ensure continuity of NatWest-savvy consultants
opportunities.description: Fiona perceives better outcomes when long-standing Korn Ferry consultants who know NatWest’s culture remain actively involved, even when functional practice leads are engaged. Standardizing continuity would improve consistency across functions (e.g., HR).
opportunities.supportingQuote: In HR work, "we just felt that Hilary and Samira got what we were looking for... they ended up being more involved and taking the lead... we felt that we gained a better service when [they] were involved."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create an account continuity model that keeps a core NatWest account team embedded on every search, with practice leads added as specialists rather than replacing core leads.

opportunities.title: Standardize delivery approach across business areas
opportunities.description: The interview highlights a need to embed shared client knowledge and ways of working so delivery remains seamless when consultants are less familiar with NatWest. This reduces variability and protects Korn Ferry’s trusted reputation amid more frequent competitive pitches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Ensure consistent approach across business areas... so delivery remains seamless, even when consultants are less familiar [with] the client."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Build a NatWest playbook (role scoping, stakeholder mapping, comms templates, cultural markers) and require onboarding for any new team member joining NatWest searches.

opportunities.title: Ongoing assessment and development insights for hires
opportunities.description: NatWest uses Korn Ferry assessments not only for selection but as a development tool after candidates land. This indicates continued demand for post-hire development insights and onboarding/coaching support tied to assessment outputs.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "we get a great richness of data... quite often [we use it as] a development tool for when they land."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a structured post-placement package (e.g., 30/60/90-day coaching and development planning) leveraging assessment results for placed executives.

opportunities.title: Rapid market insights and benchmarking support
opportunities.description: Fiona values Korn Ferry’s ability to quickly provide targeted market information and benchmarking beyond active searches. This suggests ongoing need for ad-hoc intelligence and potentially more formalized insight services.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "sometimes we might be asked to find insights on something specific... and they will always go out and come back with information for us... [they] went above and beyond... came back to us with that really quickly."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose an always-on insights retainer (market mapping, compensation benchmarks, talent availability snapshots) with agreed turnaround times.

opportunities.title: Expand assessment into broader leadership development
opportunities.description: Because assessments are already embedded and valued, Korn Ferry can deepen the relationship by extending assessment outputs into broader leadership development, succession planning, and team effectiveness work.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "all of our successful, and sometimes the final two candidates, are assessed by Korn Ferry... that's always utilised very well..."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce a proposal to connect executive search assessments to succession pipelines and leadership development programs for key functions.

opportunities.title: Proactively reinforce preferred status amid more pitches
opportunities.description: Competitive pitches are becoming more frequent to balance supplier selection and reduce internal risk, which could dilute share of work if Korn Ferry is not proactively differentiating. This is a signal to strengthen executive sponsorship and demonstrate measurable value.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "competitive pitches have become more frequent to support balanced supplier selection and reduce internal risk."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule quarterly value reviews with Fiona and key hiring-manager stakeholders, sharing outcomes (time-to-shortlist, diversity metrics, offer acceptance, assessment impact) and case studies to defend and grow share.

opportunities.title: Deepen multi-stakeholder relationships with hiring managers
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry is often appointed directly or recommended by hiring managers based on previous success. Strengthening relationships with those hiring managers can increase direct awards and reduce exposure to competitive processes.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Korn Ferry is "often appointed directly or recommended by hiring managers based on previous success."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Map top hiring-manager advocates and run targeted engagement (check-ins, market briefings, post-search debriefs) to increase direct appointments.

opportunities.title: Future searches for scarce specialist talent
