opportunities.description: The client anticipates ongoing difficulty sourcing specialist talent (medical, actuarial, finance) due to tight market supply, implying future reliance on external search support.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Future talent challenges include sourcing specialists in areas such as medical, actuarial, and finance functions, where market supply remains tight.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively share a point-of-view on specialist talent availability and propose a forward-looking search plan/pipeline approach for these roles.

opportunities.title: Support to complete ongoing VP Finance search
opportunities.description: One senior search (VP Finance & Accounting) was still in progress with final interviews planned, indicating near-term need to close and de-risk the hire.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: “one for a Vice President of Finance and Accounting, which was ongoing at the time of the interview with final interviews planned.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Run a tight close-out plan for the final stage (timeline, decision checkpoints, offer strategy, backup candidates) to ensure successful placement.

opportunities.title: Position Korn Ferry as preferred future search partner
opportunities.description: Daryl indicated Korn Ferry will be considered for future searches; there is an opportunity to formalize preferred-provider status and reduce competitive price pressure.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: Daryl confirmed that Korn Ferry would “definitely be in consideration” for future searches.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a post-search debrief and propose a preferred partnership model (rate card, SLAs, role scoping) for upcoming leadership and specialist roles.

opportunities.title: Expand use of assessment and data services
opportunities.description: The client values assessment data to build CEO confidence and HR credibility, suggesting opportunity to broaden assessment usage across more roles or add complementary talent advisory services.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: “we're really trying to focus on data to make decisions... being able to present to the CEO... the assessment data... gives us more credibility as an HR function... he loves the data”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an expanded assessment package (benchmarking, structured interview guides, onboarding/coaching insights) for future hires and internal leaders.

opportunities.title: Reinforce trust after confidentiality hiccup
opportunities.description: A sensitive communication incident created risk to trust; while Korn Ferry owned and apologized, a proactive follow-up can strengthen confidence and prevent recurrence.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: “somehow during that conversation the employee was able to determine who we selected... we hadn't communicated [it] yet... Brian absolutely owned it, he absolutely apologised.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Conduct a brief client-facing process review, confirm confidentiality safeguards, and document agreed communication protocols for future searches.

opportunities.title: Clarify who communicates candidate outcomes
opportunities.description: Candidate outcome messaging reached an internal employee before the hiring leader communicated, indicating a need to align roles and timing for candidate notifications.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: “The employee's first understanding that they didn't get the job came from Korn Ferry as opposed to the leader.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a communication RACI and a 'no-notify until client confirms' rule for internal candidates and finalists.

opportunities.title: Strengthen confidentiality and information handling
opportunities.description: An employee inferred the selected candidate before official communication, signaling the need for tighter controls on sensitive discussions and signals during late-stage searches.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: “the employee was able to determine who we selected... we hadn't communicated [it] yet”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement late-stage confidentiality protocols (need-to-know access, scripted updates, and internal reminders) and train the team on inference risk.

opportunities.title: Maintain regular cadence during quiet phases
opportunities.description: The client wants proactive weekly/biweekly touchpoints even when there are no new candidates, to maintain alignment and confidence.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Maybe being more proactive in setting up weekly or biweekly meetings even when they didn't have candidates or any additional [information].”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set standing weekly/biweekly check-ins with a standard agenda (market intel, pipeline health, risks, next actions) regardless of candidate flow.

opportunities.title: Sustain recruiting momentum until offer signed
opportunities.description: The client perceived a slowdown once finalists were identified and wants continued recruiting to avoid ending with no acceptable hire.
opportunities.company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Nebraska
opportunities.supportingQuote: “making sure that they continue to recruit until an offer is signed, sealed and delivered, it feels like it slows down considerably once two or three candidates are kind of at the top of the list.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Adopt a 'keep building the bench' policy with explicit pipeline targets and continued outreach until the candidate accepts and clears contingencies.

opportunities.title: Introduce loyalty-based pricing for repeat searches
opportunities.description: Lew feels the current fee model is largely standard and doesn’t sufficiently recognize the volume and longevity of the relationship. A clearer repeat-client pricing structure could protect loyalty and reduce price friction in future searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It's a pretty standard offering from a pricing perspective... we've negotiated a slight discount... although I think I deserve a lower fee.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a tiered preferred-client/volume pricing agreement (e.g., annual retainer or multi-search bundle) tied to expected search cadence.

opportunities.title: Make post-placement follow-up more visible
opportunities.description: Lew isn’t consistently aware of structured post-placement check-ins with placed candidates, even though he assumes it happens. Increasing visibility would reinforce value, improve retention outcomes, and strengthen trust.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I'm not aware of them following back up with candidates... they obviously always check on the people that they placed.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement and share a standard post-placement cadence (e.g., 30/60/90/180-day check-ins) with brief written updates to Lew.

opportunities.title: Cross-sell broader consulting and strategy services
opportunities.description: Lew primarily associates Korn Ferry with executive search and has low awareness of non-search offerings. This is an opportunity to expand into adjacent services (e.g., org/leadership effectiveness, workforce strategy) that support his talent agenda.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “In my mind they are great long-term partners in helping me secure talent.” (and) “Broader awareness of Korn Ferry's non-search offerings... remains low.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a short capabilities session tailored to Giving Home Health Care’s priorities, highlighting 1–2 relevant non-search offerings with concrete use cases.

opportunities.title: Strengthen relationship with executive events and touches
opportunities.description: Lew values personal relationships and explicitly noted he’s still waiting for an invite to a Korn Ferry Tour Pro-Am. Small, high-touch engagement can reinforce loyalty and keep Korn Ferry top-of-mind between searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I'm a relationship guy...” and he “was still waiting for an invite to go Pro AM on the Korn Ferry tour.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Invite Lew to a relevant Korn Ferry event (including the Pro-Am if feasible) and set a quarterly relationship touchpoint outside active searches.

opportunities.title: Ongoing senior talent searches at high cadence
opportunities.description: Lew has used Korn Ferry roughly ten times across two organizations and has completed five searches in the last 3.5 years in his current role, indicating continued demand for senior hiring support. Planning for recurring searches could improve speed and consistency.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “In my previous role, I probably used Korn Ferry five times... in this role, this is the fifth time in three and a half years that we've used Korn Ferry.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively align on a 12–18 month talent roadmap and create a standing success-profile library to accelerate future searches.

opportunities.title: Support upcoming second Senior Director hire
opportunities.description: Generac expects to open another Senior Director role next year, creating a clear near-term need for search support. Staying close now increases likelihood Korn Ferry is engaged as the default partner.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Generac plans to open a second Senior Director role next year; maintain visibility to support that hire.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a quarterly check-in cadence and pre-align on role scope/compensation so Korn Ferry can launch quickly when the requisition opens.

opportunities.title: Expand beyond search into people advisory work
opportunities.description: Jen already values Korn Ferry for org and culture work, indicating openness to additional advisory engagements beyond executive search. This can deepen the relationship and increase share of wallet.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We used them last year for our spans and layers exercise, our culture assessment... and a few other HR related projects.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively propose a 6–12 month people/organization roadmap (e.g., org design, capability building) tied to Strategy/M&A/ESG priorities.

opportunities.title: Higher-level talent for AI-driven operating model
opportunities.description: Automation and AI are shifting work away from execution toward higher-level analysis and oversight, implying future demand for more senior, analytically strong leaders in Strategy/M&A/ESG-adjacent roles. Korn Ferry can help define roles and source this upgraded talent.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “[It’s] driving [a need for] higher level people to be able to analyse... and then [ensure] we're driving the correct conclusions out of all the data.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a short workforce/role design session to translate the AI/automation shift into updated role profiles and a target talent map.

opportunities.title: Flag compensation and level misalignment earlier
opportunities.description: The ESG search stalled partly because compensation and role seniority were misaligned with the market, and Jen felt Korn Ferry did not push this strongly enough upfront. Earlier, firmer market calibration would prevent wasted cycles and protect credibility.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They probably didn't flag it [compensation misalignment] as much as we realistically needed... it was a mismatch upfront with expectation versus compensation.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a mandatory early-market calibration deliverable (comp ranges, level mapping, feasibility) with explicit go/no-go recommendations.

opportunities.title: Improve candidate seniority and fit for ESG role
opportunities.description: For the ESG director search, candidates presented skewed too junior for Generac’s needs, indicating a gap in level-setting, sourcing strategy, or screening against the true bar. Tightening the level definition and screening criteria would improve slate quality.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We ended up getting quite junior people for a director-level role... [that wasn't] going to work for our organisation.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Reconfirm the role’s level and success profile with a structured intake and adjust sourcing channels/target companies to reach appropriately senior ESG leaders.

opportunities.title: Standardize client experience across search teams
opportunities.description: Jen experienced meaningful variation between the M&A and ESG teams, with the M&A process setting a higher benchmark for structure and reporting. Standardizing best practices would create a consistent, premium experience regardless of practice area.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Variation in experience and delivery style between teams.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Codify the M&A team’s weekly tracker/reporting and candidate prep package as a firmwide standard for all searches.

opportunities.title: Proactively follow up on paused ESG search
opportunities.description: The ESG role was paused rather than definitively closed, and Jen noted an opportunity for proactive communication and follow-up when roles remain open or paused. Continued light-touch engagement can rebuild momentum and position Korn Ferry for restart.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Opportunity to strengthen continuity through proactive communication and follow-up when roles remain open or paused.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Agree a reactivation plan (monthly market pulse + occasional standout profiles) and schedule a decision checkpoint to revisit scope/compensation.

opportunities.title: Formalize relationship manager across engagements
opportunities.description: Jen valued an informal relationship manager who provided continuity across two different search teams, suggesting a scalable model to deepen trust and reduce fragmentation. Making this role explicit can improve retention and cross-sell.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “She kind of shepherded the processes to make sure things were going well... that was really beneficial for me.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Assign a named account/relationship lead for Generac to coordinate across practices and surface adjacent needs proactively.

opportunities.title: Use assessment tools when hiring increases
opportunities.description: Jen sees Korn Ferry’s assessment/benchmarking tools as optional for single hires but would consider them if hiring volume increases. This indicates future potential to attach assessments to larger hiring waves or team builds.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “If I were hiring more people, I would have probably engaged in [it].”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Keep a lightweight assessment option ready and revisit when the next multi-hire initiative or team build is planned.

opportunities.title: Next phase of lifecycle measurement support
opportunities.description: Ferrero is moving beyond engagement surveying into broader employee lifecycle measurement and will likely need continued advisory, design, and rollout support on Trix and related measurement strategy.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Korn Ferry continues to partner with Ferrero on the next phase of employee lifecycle measurement.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively propose a phased roadmap for lifecycle measurement (listening architecture, governance, cadence, and analytics) with clear milestones for the next 6–12 months.

opportunities.title: Support cultural integration through acquisitions
opportunities.description: Ferrero’s rapid growth via acquisition creates a need to understand and unify sentiment across different legacy cultures, where measurement insights can be translated into integration actions.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “we've doubled the number of employees within the last 10 years...50% of our employees didn't start their journey in Ferrero, they were acquired by Ferrero.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an acquisition integration listening and action-planning package (segmented insights by legacy group, integration pulse checks, and leader toolkits).

opportunities.title: Expand into senior leader engagement and training
opportunities.description: Matthew valued Korn Ferry’s proactive involvement with senior leaders and training; formalizing this could deepen the partnership and increase impact of survey results.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “maybe we need to do a meeting with your senior leaders... If I can get involved with the training, that would be great.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Package and propose recurring senior-leader readouts plus manager training on interpreting results and driving actions, aligned to the survey calendar.

opportunities.title: Broaden footprint across existing Ferrero services
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry already supports Ferrero with 360 feedback and pay grading; there is an opportunity to connect these offerings with engagement and lifecycle insights for an integrated people strategy.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They've supported our business in other elements, we've used them for 360 and they work with us on pay grading.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Run an account planning session to identify cross-sell opportunities that link engagement insights to leadership development (360) and rewards/job architecture (pay grading).

opportunities.title: Maintain momentum and stay proactively involved
opportunities.description: The client explicitly values Korn Ferry’s proactive, long-term partnership approach; maintaining frequent, forward-looking touchpoints will help protect and strengthen the relationship as needs evolve.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “it really felt like they wanted to create a really strong partnership with us for the long term” and “they've always been really proactive.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a quarterly partnership governance cadence (QBR-style) to review outcomes, upcoming people priorities, and next-phase initiatives.

opportunities.title: Standardize more reassuring, solution-oriented communication
opportunities.description: One project manager’s risk-heavy tone created fear and undermined confidence despite strong technical delivery; aligning communication style to be balanced and success-oriented would improve stakeholder experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “focus on the risks and the negatives... struck a lot of fear... rather than focusing on how we were going to succeed.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Coach project leads on stakeholder communication (risk framing, constructive language, and confidence-building updates) and add a simple comms standard for status meetings.

opportunities.title: Be more assertive in compensation negotiations
opportunities.description: The client wanted Korn Ferry to challenge candidate compensation expectations more strongly and provide clearer negotiation guidance. This was the only recurring improvement point and directly affects offer acceptance and client confidence in advisory support.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I would have expected a little bit more of support... I would have appreciated a little bit more of challenging behaviour versus the candidate."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Provide a structured compensation advisory package (benchmarking, negotiation strategy, and candidate expectation management) and proactively lead the client through it before offer stage.

opportunities.title: Improve alignment in the initial briefing
opportunities.description: One stakeholder felt the first briefing did not fully capture the nuance of what they wanted, even though it was later resolved. Tightening early discovery reduces risk of misalignment and accelerates delivery on complex briefs.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "My experience of the actual briefing call was not a good one... I felt they didn't fully grasp what we wanted."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Run a more rigorous kickoff (role success profile, must-haves vs nice-to-haves, and written alignment recap) and confirm sign-off before sourcing.

opportunities.title: Offer compensation benchmarking and market intelligence
opportunities.description: They negotiated autonomously and Korn Ferry did not provide compensation benchmarking; future searches would benefit from market data to set ranges and strengthen negotiation posture. This is a natural add-on given the niche market context.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "We did it autonomously... we had our numbers in our mind." (and Korn Ferry was not asked to manage the final offer and did not advise on compensation benchmarking)
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively include compensation benchmarking and a recommended offer framework as a standard deliverable for senior searches.

opportunities.title: Add post-placement onboarding and follow-up
opportunities.description: It was unclear whether Korn Ferry followed up with the hire, suggesting an opportunity to formalize post-placement check-ins to protect retention and strengthen the partnership. Even if not needed in this case, offering it consistently can differentiate service.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I don't know. I have no idea if they did follow up... there was no need for them to support us."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce a standard 30/60/90-day post-placement follow-up with both client and candidate and communicate it clearly at the start of the engagement.

opportunities.title: Convert strong advocacy into repeat search pipeline
opportunities.description: Both stakeholders explicitly said they would use Korn Ferry again and recommend them, creating a clear opening to secure future mandates and referrals. A timely follow-up can lock in preferred-supplier status for similar niche senior roles.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I would say yes, yes." and "I would advise other people using them."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule an executive debrief to capture upcoming leadership needs, ask for referrals internally, and agree a plan for future searches in the same niche area.

opportunities.title: Be first call for future executive searches
opportunities.description: Michael indicated Korn Ferry would be his first contact for future searches, suggesting likely upcoming demand for additional executive search support as needs arise.
opportunities.supportingQuote: He noted that they would be the first people contacted for any future searches.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Maintain regular check-ins and proactively discuss upcoming leadership needs and succession priorities to be positioned for the next search.

opportunities.title: Extend continuity model across Penn engagements
opportunities.description: Continuity of consultants who know Penn was explicitly valued and improved communication; formalizing this as an account approach can deepen the relationship and increase repeat work.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We were really impressed by Sophie... because she knows the institution, she knows us... It served all of us really well - she could speak both Korn Ferry and Penn.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a dedicated Penn core team/bench (with named roles) to support all future searches and related advisory work.

opportunities.title: Leverage stakeholder-management strength for similar roles
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry’s “white-glove” handling of a sensitive government relations search is a differentiator that can be positioned for other high-stakes, stakeholder-heavy roles across the university.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It felt as though it was a level of white-glove service... managing expectations throughout... they did a phenomenal job.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Share a brief case study/approach document and suggest where this stakeholder-management playbook could apply to other Penn leadership searches.

opportunities.title: Sustain between-search touchpoints with Peter
opportunities.description: Regular check-ins between searches are a key relationship anchor; continuing (and slightly formalizing) them reduces risk of competitor entry and keeps Korn Ferry top-of-mind.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Peter remains Michael’s main point of contact, maintaining regular check-ins between searches.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a quarterly cadence with a light agenda (market intel, talent mapping, upcoming needs) and document action items to reinforce partnership value.

opportunities.title: Clarify division of labor for candidate-day logistics
opportunities.description: On-campus candidate visit logistics were repeatedly “clunky,” driven by unclear coordination and duplicated back-and-forth; tightening ownership and process would improve experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Candidate-day logistics... were described as “a bit clunky” and there was “an opportunity... to just sync... ‘what’s the division of labour? Who’s going to do what?’ rather than... back and forth emails.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce a single logistics owner and a pre-visit planning checklist/RACI agreed at kickoff to streamline scheduling, communications, and day-of execution.

opportunities.title: Rework or right-size KF4D assessment value
opportunities.description: The KF4D assessment was perceived as underwhelming and potentially expendable in cost containment; improving delivery, tailoring insights, or offering an opt-in alternative would protect value perception.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I wasn't blown away... If given a choice, and if we were in cost containment mode, I would cut that [KF4D] and feel like we wouldn't lose anything.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Conduct a brief post-search debrief on assessment usefulness and propose a revised, role-specific assessment readout (or alternative) with clear decision-impact examples.

opportunities.title: Senior leadership relationship recovery conversation
opportunities.description: Leslie’s confidence was undermined by repeated process failures, but she is explicitly open to discussing feedback with senior leadership. A proactive executive-level outreach can acknowledge impact, demonstrate accountability, and rebuild trust.
opportunities.supportingQuote: They valued Korn Ferry’s openness to feedback and said they would be comfortable discussing these points further with senior leadership to help improve future delivery.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Arrange a senior leader call to acknowledge issues, apologize for impact, share corrective actions, and agree a communication/QA plan for any future work.

opportunities.title: Fix scheduling and interview coordination controls
opportunities.description: Multiple scheduling/coordination breakdowns created client embarrassment and wasted executive time, directly eroding trust. Stronger operational controls and confirmations are needed to prevent repeats.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “the guy pulled out from the interview 15 minutes before the Zoom call and no one told us… So three executives sitting on this call” and “my most important candidate got invited to a zoom interview with the other leading candidate.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a mandatory pre-interview confirmation protocol (candidate confirmation + client notification), double-check attendee lists, and a real-time escalation path for last-minute changes.

opportunities.title: Standardize client recovery and apology playbook
opportunities.description: When issues occurred, Leslie perceived responses as defensive rather than empathetic, missing a key moment to restore confidence. A consistent recovery approach should emphasize ownership, apology, and concrete remediation.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It was just always like ‘Oh, we’re so sorry that happened, but I was in the meeting.’… what you should be saying is ‘We’re so embarrassed… This will never happen again… We’ve already fixed the problem, what else can we do…?’”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Train teams on a client-recovery script and require a same-day recovery call/email that includes apology, root-cause summary, fix implemented, and make-good options.

opportunities.title: Increase QA oversight across search execution
opportunities.description: Repeated errors led Leslie to question whether other critical steps (contracts, references, background checks) were being done correctly. A visible QA layer would reduce perceived risk and restore confidence in delivery.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Then it makes you start to question everything else. Are they going to get the contract right?… You’re doing the background checks… They’re the one doing the references, not me.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Add a formal QA checkpoint cadence (e.g., weekly QA review + checklist sign-offs for scheduling, candidate comms, references, offer process) and share status transparently with the client.

opportunities.title: Upgrade deliverable quality beyond AI repurposing
opportunities.description: Leslie expected Korn Ferry’s expert, human-led insight and was disappointed by materials that appeared AI-generated and required her to redo them. Improving the quality and customization of early deliverables would better match brand expectations.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I was a little disappointed… I could tell they had leveraged AI a lot… I need you to actually be the human who knows what they’re doing… I ended up redoing it.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a deliverable standard that requires consultant-authored synthesis (role/scorecard, outreach narrative, market mapping) with a senior review before sending to the client.

opportunities.title: Strengthen candidate commitment and risk monitoring
opportunities.description: A finalist accepted and then took another job, and Leslie was surprised Korn Ferry was unaware of competing processes. More rigorous candidate risk tracking and communication could reduce late-stage surprises.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “He signed the offer… and I got a voicemail… saying he’s taken another job… [Korn Ferry was] completely surprised too and I’m like ‘how could you be this surprised?’”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce a candidate risk log (competing interviews, decision timelines, counteroffer risk) with frequent check-ins and immediate client alerts when risk indicators change.

opportunities.title: Ongoing support for future executive hiring
opportunities.description: Leslie has used Korn Ferry successfully before and came back after two failed searches elsewhere, indicating likely future leadership hiring needs if trust is restored. Ensuring a stronger delivery model positions Korn Ferry for repeat searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Leslie engaged Korn Ferry to recruit a Chief Success Officer after two failed searches with other firms and previously used Korn Ferry to appoint a Chief Learning Officer, described as a “good search” that delivered “the right person.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a forward-looking hiring partnership plan (next likely roles, timelines, and a refined delivery/QA approach) once relationship recovery steps are completed.

opportunities.title: Offer process improvement and search governance package
opportunities.description: The issues described are largely operational (scheduling, comms, QA, recovery), suggesting an opportunity to provide a more structured governance model and premium project management layer. This can deepen the relationship by reducing client burden and risk.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It feels like it’s a systems thing… a system that failed them” and concerns about “communication, scheduling, quality control, and client recovery.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an enhanced search governance option (dedicated project manager, documented comms cadence, QA checklist, escalation paths) for future engagements.

opportunities.title: Future CEO or leadership searches
opportunities.description: Michael indicated he would re-engage Jena immediately for any future CEO search, implying likely future executive search needs as leadership changes arise.
opportunities.supportingQuote: He "would immediately re-engage Jena for any future CEO search."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a light-touch cadence with Michael/Jena (e.g., quarterly check-ins) to stay close to upcoming leadership succession needs.

opportunities.title: Expand beyond executive search services
opportunities.description: OneBlood currently uses Korn Ferry only for Executive Search, creating an opening to introduce adjacent offerings that support the CEO/board (e.g., leadership assessment, onboarding, succession planning, compensation/benefits advisory).
opportunities.supportingQuote: Michael confirmed this is the only service they currently use Korn Ferry for.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a targeted add-on package for the new CEO transition (onboarding + leadership team assessment + succession planning) tied to the mid-November start.

opportunities.title: Protect relationship centered on Jena
opportunities.description: The relationship is strongly person-dependent, with Jena described as the linchpin; Korn Ferry should ensure continuity and avoid single-threaded risk by broadening trusted connections while keeping Jena front-and-center.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Jena was viewed as central to the relationship: "She was the linchpin… when something works for you, you stick with it."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a relationship map and introduce 1–2 additional Korn Ferry leaders (with Jena) to the board to build resilience without diluting trust.

opportunities.title: Leverage referrals and advocacy momentum
opportunities.description: Michael has already recommended Jena to others and views Korn Ferry as operating at a higher level than competitors, presenting an opportunity to formalize referrals and capture new healthcare search work.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I’ve recommended her to other people that I know." and Korn Ferry operates at a "higher level."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Ask Michael for 2–3 specific introductions to peer board chairs/CEOs in healthcare and provide a short, shareable case summary of the OneBlood search.

opportunities.title: New CEO onboarding and early success support
opportunities.description: With a new CEO starting mid-November, OneBlood may benefit from structured onboarding, stakeholder alignment, and first-90-days planning to sustain the successful placement outcome.
opportunities.supportingQuote: The search concluded successfully with the appointment of a new CEO starting mid-November.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a CEO onboarding and assimilation program (board/exec stakeholder interviews + 90-day plan facilitation) timed to the CEO’s start date.

opportunities.title: Codify and replicate the “magic” process
opportunities.description: While no gaps were raised, the client praised specific elements (structured timeline, transparent communication, negotiation support, board-feedback tools) that can be standardized as a repeatable best-practice playbook.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "They figured out their magic" and "We set up a timeline... we were on a schedule... everything moved."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Document the end-to-end approach used here as a reusable healthcare CEO search playbook and train relevant teams to replicate it.

opportunities.title: Broaden relationship beyond Sasha to Korn Ferry
opportunities.description: The initial buying decision was driven by Sasha’s personal reputation more than Korn Ferry’s brand, creating an opportunity to institutionalize the relationship and reduce key-person dependency.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “The decision was based more on the individual’s reputation than on the organisation.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce Matthias to relevant Korn Ferry leaders/experts in Switzerland and position Korn Ferry’s team-based delivery model for continuity.

opportunities.title: Support follow-on hiring in central Switzerland
opportunities.description: Korn Ferry has already been re-engaged, indicating likely ongoing hiring needs as Format builds its business in central Switzerland.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Korn Ferry has already been re-engaged for a subsequent mandate.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Run a forward-looking workforce/hiring plan discussion to map upcoming roles and timelines and propose a multi-search roadmap.

opportunities.title: Position assessment services for future mandates
opportunities.description: Although assessments were not used this time, Korn Ferry’s assessment options were discussed and could be valuable for future hires where differentiation is less clear or risk is higher.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “While Korn Ferry offered additional assessment options, Matthias chose not to use them.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a light-touch, role-specific assessment package (optional) for the next mandate, tied to decision risk and onboarding success.

opportunities.title: Maintain bi-weekly updates and transparent candor
opportunities.description: The client strongly valued pragmatic, bi-weekly communication and frank calibration of candidate strength; maintaining this standard is critical to preserve satisfaction in future searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “bi-weekly calls with updates… so that was perfectly fine” and “This is not the strongest… you decide.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Codify the communication cadence and ‘candor standard’ in the kickoff plan for each new mandate and review it mid-search.

opportunities.title: Continue high responsiveness during final negotiations
opportunities.description: Fast turnaround and accessibility were especially important in the closing phase when competing for the candidate; replicating this will improve close rates on future mandates.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “in the final phase… [they] returned calls immediately [and were] accessible.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set an internal ‘final-stage SLA’ (same-day responses, rapid scheduling) and assign clear ownership for offer/closing support.

opportunities.title: Ongoing help selling performance-based compensation model
opportunities.description: Format’s distinctive compensation structure requires careful positioning to candidates; continued support in messaging and negotiation will likely be needed for future hires.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “He had to clearly sell ourselves in an appropriate way” regarding the lower base/higher bonus model.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Develop a repeatable candidate pitch pack and negotiation narrative for the compensation model to use across future searches.

opportunities.title: Proactively connect broader Korn Ferry capabilities
opportunities.description: There is an explicit recommendation to increase awareness of Korn Ferry’s wider expertise, suggesting a need to re-engage beyond the immediate search work to strengthen the partnership.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Extend awareness of broader expertise… proactively link Korn Ferry's relevant wider capabilities to Format's ongoing people and organisational priorities.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule an executive check-in to explore Format’s broader people priorities and present 2–3 relevant Korn Ferry offerings with clear use cases.

opportunities.title: Become preferred partner for future searches
opportunities.description: Philippe indicated strong intent to work with Korn Ferry again and not benchmark other firms, creating an opportunity to formalize Korn Ferry as the go-to partner for EMEA executive search needs.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Definitely no brainer... I wouldn't even benchmark."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a preferred-supplier/partnering agreement for EMEA executive search with agreed ways of working and points of contact.

opportunities.title: Ongoing senior EMEA hiring support
opportunities.description: As HR Manager for EMEA responsible for all hiring, Philippe is likely to have recurring senior hiring needs where Korn Ferry can support beyond this first assignment.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Philippe is "responsible for all hiring across the region" and said he would choose Korn Ferry again.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a quarterly talent/hiring planning check-in to anticipate upcoming senior roles and align on search support early.

opportunities.title: Extend market mapping and compensation benchmarking
opportunities.description: Philippe valued Korn Ferry’s market insight and detailed compensation breakdowns, suggesting an opportunity to provide ongoing benchmarking, role calibration, and talent mapping services.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "They were crystal clear... a complete drill down about the salary package." and "It was always an open discussion... finding common grounds."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a light annual/biannual compensation and talent-market benchmarking pack for key EMEA functions (starting with Finance).

opportunities.title: Protect relationship beyond single trusted contact
opportunities.description: The relationship is strongly anchored on Olivier personally; Korn Ferry should broaden stakeholder connections to reduce key-person dependency and strengthen the institutional partnership.
opportunities.supportingQuote: They "already knew Olivier personally" and Philippe said he would choose "him/Korn Ferry again."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce 1–2 additional Korn Ferry leaders (e.g., EMEA Search lead, Research lead) in a short post-search debrief to build multi-threaded relationships.

opportunities.title: Codify and repeat the winning delivery playbook
opportunities.description: No service gaps were raised, but Philippe explicitly valued specific elements (early researcher involvement, structured candidate materials, transparent communication) that should be standardized to ensure consistent delivery on future assignments.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "He involved his researchers straight away... otherwise you always lose some essence about it." and "The PowerPoint was built quite well... one pager with matching points... salary."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Document this engagement’s process (researcher kickoff, touchpoints cadence, candidate one-pager + comp drill-down templates) as the default approach for similar searches.

opportunities.title: Introduce broader Korn Ferry offerings proactively
opportunities.description: Keith is highly satisfied with search but does not naturally consider Korn Ferry for other services due to limited time and headspace. A simple, targeted approach could expand the relationship beyond executive search without changing what he values most (trusted, human-led partnership).
opportunities.supportingQuote: “When I need something, I go looking... I don't often pick my head up and look around...I get great emails... I just don't ever find the time.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Have Chris schedule a brief quarterly value-review to surface 1–2 relevant non-search supports (e.g., onboarding/leader integration using assessments) tied to current hires and business priorities.

opportunities.title: Curated peer networking for retail distribution leaders
opportunities.description: Keith would value Korn Ferry-facilitated, smaller peer groups as an alternative to large industry forums he finds unproductive. This is a clear future support need that aligns with relationship-building and thought partnership.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “If networking became part of that... that would be helpful.” (and industry forums are “exhausting” and lack meaningful value)
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer an invite-only, small-group peer roundtable for senior retail distribution leaders (virtual or local), curated and lightly facilitated by Korn Ferry.

opportunities.title: Reduce single-thread dependency on Chris relationship
opportunities.description: Keith’s loyalty is strongly tied to one individual, creating retention risk if Chris changes roles or becomes less available. Strengthening multi-threaded relationships can protect and deepen the partnership while maintaining the personal feel Keith values.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Anywhere Chris went, I would go.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce one additional senior Korn Ferry contact (kept consistent) into key touchpoints so Keith builds trust beyond a single relationship without adding complexity.

opportunities.title: Reinforce human-led search; limit AI emphasis
opportunities.description: Keith explicitly prefers human judgment and would react negatively to an AI-forward search experience. Ensuring the process is clearly consultant-led (with any AI positioned as behind-the-scenes support) will protect satisfaction and advocacy.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I would hate it if... there's weird AI searches” and “The slower Korn Ferry is to adopt some of the AI stuff... probably the better.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively communicate that searches remain human-led and, if AI is used, explain it only as an assistive tool that does not replace consultant judgment or relationship-driven evaluation.

opportunities.title: Expand assessment use into onboarding integration
opportunities.description: Keith already finds Korn Ferry assessments helpful and uses them for onboarding and management, indicating openness to deeper, structured support around leader integration and early performance. This can extend value post-hire without shifting away from search.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Yes, I use that tool. I find it very helpful.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Package a lightweight post-hire onboarding/90-day integration session using assessment insights for the new hire and hiring manager.

opportunities.title: Send candidate packs the night before
opportunities.description: Late delivery of candidate materials is repeatedly cited as the main operational friction, reducing Paul’s ability to prepare and making meetings less efficient. Providing packs earlier would improve meeting quality and client experience immediately.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They would always send the book out usually in the morning, two hours before the meeting… You just haven't got time to look at it… It would be really good to get that the night before… it would speed up the meeting.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set and enforce an internal SLA to deliver candidate packs by end-of-day prior to client meetings (with a named owner and backup).

opportunities.title: Introduce assessment for CEO/CFO hiring
opportunities.description: Paul was unaware Korn Ferry offers assessment, indicating an opportunity to add assessment to executive search engagements to strengthen decision-making and de-risk hires. This can deepen the relationship beyond search-only delivery.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I didn't know they had an assessment.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively propose a tailored assessment package (e.g., leadership assessment and referencing) as a standard option alongside CEO/CFO shortlists.

opportunities.title: Cross-sell organisation consulting and advisory services
opportunities.description: Paul primarily associates Korn Ferry with search and says other offerings haven’t been promoted, suggesting untapped demand for broader support (e.g., org design, leadership advisory). A clearer, joined-up story could expand share of wallet with the Chair/Board.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They wouldn't register in my head because they've never pushed it… Their practices need a bit more joined up thinking.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a short capabilities session with Paul to map upcoming board/leadership priorities to Korn Ferry’s consulting and advisory solutions.

opportunities.title: Strengthen cross-practice coordination and visibility
opportunities.description: Paul’s comment about siloed practices signals a risk that Korn Ferry is seen as search-only and not fully integrated, which can limit future opportunities. Improving coordination and proactive communication can reinforce partnership strength.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Their practices need a bit more joined up thinking.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Assign an account lead to orchestrate a unified cross-practice plan and ensure consistent, proactive updates on relevant capabilities.

opportunities.title: Support hard-to-fill niche sector searches
opportunities.description: Paul highlights low mobility in housebuilding and difficulty attracting senior talent, implying future need for creative sourcing, market mapping, and potentially broader candidate adjacency strategies. Korn Ferry can position itself as the go-to partner for these constrained talent markets.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It’s a very specific market… people don’t change jobs that often.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a proactive talent mapping and adjacency-market strategy for niche sectors (e.g., housebuilding) ahead of the next senior hire.

opportunities.title: Leverage selective peer events to deepen ties
opportunities.description: Paul attends Korn Ferry peer events and values occasional participation, which can be used to strengthen relationships and surface new needs. This is a low-friction way to maintain engagement between searches.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Engagement appetite for networking events… sees value in selective, occasional participation.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Invite Paul to a small number of highly relevant Chair/Board peer sessions and follow up with a 1:1 to capture emerging needs.

opportunities.title: Tighten candidate scheduling across time zones
opportunities.description: There was a one-off escalation where a candidate struggled to connect with a Korn Ferry representative due to time zone and coordination issues. Improving scheduling reliability would reduce friction in a critical, high-visibility part of the engagement.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "They had a candidate who couldn't seem to connect... it was like phone tag and email tag... Over five, six years, that was the only escalation I ever had."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a standardized global scheduling protocol (clear SLAs, backup contacts, and automated scheduling options) for candidate assessments.

opportunities.title: Guidance on AI use in recruitment
opportunities.description: Joanne flagged AI in recruitment as an emerging concern and wants practical guidance on pitfalls and candidate impacts. This indicates a near-term advisory need as PMI evolves its application and assessment processes.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “AI in recruitment is an emerging concern… need for guidance on pitfalls and candidate impacts related to AI tools in application processes.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Provide a short briefing and tailored recommendations on responsible AI use in candidate screening and assessment for PMI’s governance context.

opportunities.title: Increase awareness of Korn Ferry capabilities
opportunities.description: Joanne wants a better understanding of Korn Ferry’s broader offerings so she can route internal inquiries appropriately. This creates an opportunity to expand into adjacent services through informed internal referrals rather than direct selling.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Better understanding the breadth of what they offer... would be helpful." / "I probably... wouldn't know where else to point them to."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Share a concise, role-relevant capabilities map and hold a short enablement session focused on common PMI use cases and referral paths.

opportunities.title: Facilitate peer-to-peer governance leader network
opportunities.description: Joanne is interested in learning from peers who run similar nominating and governance processes, beyond Korn Ferry’s direct guidance. Korn Ferry can deepen the relationship by convening a curated peer forum or roundtable series.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I would welcome that... I'm not learning from others that are facilitating a nominating process... peer-to-peer networking would always be [helpful]."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Create a quarterly virtual roundtable for governance/nominating leaders with curated topics and anonymized benchmarking insights.

opportunities.title: Ongoing trend synthesis and practical interpretation
opportunities.description: Joanne relies on Korn Ferry to bring trends and data points she should be paying attention to, and she has limited time to seek these insights independently. This suggests continued demand for structured, periodic advisory updates.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "She's able to bring trends and data points in this space that I better be paying attention to." / "High interest in industry insights but limited time to seek them independently."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a lightweight cadence (e.g., biannual governance insights briefing) translating market trends into implications for PMI’s board and volunteer governance processes.

opportunities.title: Reduce single-thread dependency on Miriam
opportunities.description: The relationship is heavily centered on one lead (Miriam), which is a continuity risk even in a highly positive account. Strengthening the broader relationship network would protect the partnership and improve resilience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "It is all Miriam." / "Her relationship with Korn Ferry is longstanding... led primarily by Miriam Michaels."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Introduce a small, consistent bench (secondary relationship owner and specialist leads) with defined roles while keeping Miriam as primary sponsor.

opportunities.title: Add bonus vs non-bonus benchmarking filters
opportunities.description: Metro needs market data outputs that can clearly differentiate and filter companies that pay bonuses versus those that do not. This would improve the accuracy and usability of their benchmarking submissions.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I miss... very specific aspects... I cannot say I don't want to see only companies who pay a bonus... sometimes I'm not happy with this kind of data submission."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Enhance market data configurability by adding explicit bonus-practice filters and clearly labeling bonus-included vs bonus-excluded peer groups in outputs.

opportunities.title: Provide practical, affordable grading tool
opportunities.description: Felix built an internal grading tool because Korn Ferry did not provide one that was both useful and reasonably priced. Offering a fit-for-purpose tool would remove friction and increase adoption of the methodology.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I've also created a grading tool by ourselves, because they don't provide one which is very useful or not too expensive."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a cost-effective grading tool (or tiered pricing) aligned to the job evaluation methodology, with a clear value proposition versus building in-house.

opportunities.title: Modernize training with interactive e-learning
opportunities.description: The client wants more contemporary, engaging learning materials (e-learning, videos) to make training easier to consume and scale internally. Updating training formats would improve user experience and capability building.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I would wish to have something like more interactive... a nice movie and e-learning would also be helpful... could be a bit more modern."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Develop modular e-learning and short video-based training for the methodology, with role-based learning paths for HR and business users.

opportunities.title: Guidance for functional vs hierarchical leadership roles
opportunities.description: Benchmarking and evaluation are harder for roles with functional leadership or mixed reporting lines, especially in project organizations. Practical guidance and examples would help Metro apply the methodology consistently.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Many people have functional leadership roles in comparison with hierarchical... can be difficult."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Provide a playbook with examples, decision rules, and advisory support for evaluating roles in matrix/project structures and functional leadership scenarios.

opportunities.title: Ongoing support for evolving project scope
opportunities.description: Metro’s internal plans and project goals changed repeatedly, creating complexity that may recur in future compensation framework work. They may need structured change-management support and flexible delivery to accommodate shifting requirements.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "We changed the project goals many times... it was very, very complicated to Korn Ferry... it was more our chaotic project style."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a flexible engagement model (change-control, sprint-based checkpoints, and governance) to support future projects with shifting scope.

opportunities.title: Upsell market data enhancements and analytics
opportunities.description: Because data flexibility is a key pain point, Metro is a candidate for expanded data/analytics offerings that provide more configurable peer groups and clearer benchmarking outputs. This deepens reliance on Korn Ferry for compensation decision support.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Felix noted a "significant gap" in the ability to customize benchmarking groups, especially regarding bonus practices, and dissatisfaction with current data submissions.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a data-focused working session to map required peer-group filters (e.g., bonus practices) and propose an upgraded data package or custom analytics solution.

opportunities.title: Offer training subscription for broader internal rollout
opportunities.description: Interest in modern training suggests an opportunity to expand from project-based support to ongoing enablement for HR and managers. A scalable training offering could increase adoption and stickiness of the methodology.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "A nice movie and e-learning would also be helpful."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose an annual enablement package including e-learning access, refresher sessions, and office hours for new users and managers.

opportunities.title: Proactively confirm future use-case and context
opportunities.description: Felix is open to using Korn Ferry again but framed it as context-dependent, indicating a need for proactive follow-up to secure the next engagement. Reinforcing value in the areas they care about (data flexibility, tools, training) can convert passives to promoters.
opportunities.supportingQuote: They "would consider using Korn Ferry again depending on context."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a follow-up meeting to understand upcoming compensation/rewards initiatives and present a targeted roadmap addressing data filters, tooling, and modern training.

opportunities.title: CEO onboarding and transition support
opportunities.description: The client expects Korn Ferry to provide onboarding support for the newly hired CEO, but it has not started yet. Delivering this well will be important to sustain the strong search experience into the transition phase.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They have promised us that they will be there... but it hasn't really begun yet.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively schedule and launch a structured CEO onboarding plan with clear milestones, roles, and timelines.

opportunities.title: Extend leadership assessment to broader team
opportunities.description: They valued KF4D assessments for candidates and for ensuring complementary leadership with the museum director. This creates an opening to expand assessments to the executive team and board-facing leaders to improve alignment and effectiveness.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We asked them to administer that... because we wanted to be sure their skill sets... were complementary.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a post-hire leadership alignment engagement using KF4D for the CEO and key direct reports (and/or board stakeholders).

opportunities.title: Continue compensation and market benchmarking support
opportunities.description: The museum has previously used Korn Ferry for salary surveys and market analyses, indicating ongoing needs around compensation competitiveness and market positioning. This can be formalized into an annual or semi-annual benchmarking cadence.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They had helped us with salary surveys... market analyses... job description... we'd been working with them on and off for two or three years.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a recurring compensation/market insights package tied to executive retention and workforce planning.

opportunities.title: Confirm onboarding kickoff to maintain momentum
opportunities.description: Because onboarding support was promised but not yet visible, there is a risk of a perceived drop-off after the search. A proactive check-in will reinforce partnership continuity and trust.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They have promised us that they will be there... but it hasn't really begun yet.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set an immediate executive sponsor check-in with the board/search committee to confirm onboarding scope, start date, and points of contact.

opportunities.title: Establish a single point of contact early
opportunities.description: Early-stage communication was confusing due to multiple Korn Ferry contacts reaching out, making it hard to track information. A single accountable lead (with clear backup roles) would reduce friction and improve client experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Early on, it was a little confusing... several different people... reaching out... we couldn't search for [emails] easily.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Assign one named client-facing project lead from day one and route all communications through that person (with a shared mailbox if needed).

opportunities.title: Standardize communication cadence from project start
opportunities.description: Once a predictable cadence was established, the process felt smooth and well managed. Starting with an agreed communication rhythm and update format would prevent early uncertainty.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We had a regular check-in... a Zoom call every other week... once we hit our stride, it was very smooth and a predictable cadence.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Kick off each engagement with a written communication plan (meeting schedule, update templates, and decision checkpoints).

opportunities.title: Deliver gender-balanced shortlists without reminders
opportunities.description: Jeanette repeatedly had to push for female candidates, indicating the search process did not reliably produce diverse slates. A more explicit, measurable diversity sourcing approach is needed to meet expectations and protect trust.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We had to remind the guys a number of times that we want to see women as well as men… It was quite difficult to get them to bring women to the short list.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set and track slate diversity targets from kickoff (with weekly reporting) and expand sourcing channels to ensure qualified women are presented early.

opportunities.title: Adjust team composition to support diversity outcomes
opportunities.description: The all-male consulting team negatively affected Jeanette’s perception and confidence in Korn Ferry’s ability to deliver gender-balanced sourcing. Team composition and visible commitment to inclusion can influence both outcomes and client trust.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “All the consultants from Korn Ferry were all men… it didn't really sit very well.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Staff future searches with a visibly diverse team (or add a senior female leader/advisor) and communicate the diversity sourcing plan upfront.

opportunities.title: Fix compensation discovery and offer-stage readiness
opportunities.description: Difficulty obtaining accurate compensation details created major delays, slowed offer creation, and contributed to losing a preferred candidate. Korn Ferry needs a structured, early compensation discovery process with clear data requirements.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “Trying to get out of them what current comp was, was impossible… it took forever to put an offer together… We nearly lost one of the candidates because of it.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a mandatory compensation data capture template at first candidate engagement (base/bonus/LTI/equity/guarantees/notice) and validate it before finalists progress.

opportunities.title: Provide deeper, actionable compensation benchmarking
opportunities.description: Jeanette felt Korn Ferry’s compensation guidance was too generic and not decision-useful. More specific benchmarking and rationale would improve confidence and speed in offer decisions.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We didn't get any support… we got a very blanket ‘the expectation is around about half a million’.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Deliver a tailored comp benchmark pack early (role/location/sector/size) with ranges, pay mix guidance, and implications for attraction/closing.

opportunities.title: Send candidate reports with adequate lead time
opportunities.description: Materials arriving shortly before calls prevented preparation and reduced the quality of discussions. Better pre-read timing and meeting discipline would improve the client experience immediately.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “The reports would often land an hour or two before the call… you have no hope in hell of getting to it.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Adopt an SLA to send all candidate materials at least 24–48 hours before meetings and confirm receipt/readiness ahead of calls.

opportunities.title: Lead the process with assertiveness and recommendations
opportunities.description: Jeanette expected Korn Ferry to guide decision-making, facilitate calls, and make clear recommendations, but felt she had to run the process. Stronger ownership and consultative leadership would reduce client burden and improve outcomes.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “We ended up running the calls… It always felt very hesitant… It just wasn't assertive enough.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Assign a single accountable search lead to run meetings, provide explicit shortlists/rankings with rationale, and drive next-step decisions each week.

opportunities.title: Increase pace and maintain search momentum
opportunities.description: The search took far longer than expected, creating frustration and risking candidate loss. A tighter operating cadence and milestone management is needed, especially for time-sensitive roles.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “It just took way, way longer than we thought… the best part of five months, six months.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Agree a milestone plan at kickoff (with weekly progress reporting) and escalate immediately when timelines slip or candidate responsiveness slows.

opportunities.title: Surface brief misalignment early and recalibrate
opportunities.description: Jeanette felt Korn Ferry continued in the wrong direction for too long instead of proactively flagging misalignment and adjusting. Earlier course correction would save time and improve slate quality.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “They just weren't hitting the right brief… They didn't seem to instinctively pick up that it wasn't quite right… they just kept pushing forward.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Run an early calibration checkpoint (after first market map/initial profiles) to confirm the brief and adjust search strategy before progressing candidates.

opportunities.title: Immediate recovery to prevent loss of future work
opportunities.description: Jeanette expressed doubt about using Korn Ferry again due to accumulated frustration. A proactive service recovery is needed to rebuild confidence and protect the relationship.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “I'm not sure we'll go back there again, because that was really hard work at the end.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Have a senior Korn Ferry leader conduct a post-search debrief, acknowledge issues, share corrective actions, and agree a service plan for any future engagement.

opportunities.title: Leverage CEO relationship to rebuild sponsorship
opportunities.description: The engagement was initiated through an existing CEO relationship, which can be used to reset expectations and reinforce executive sponsorship while addressing Jeanette’s concerns. Aligning CEO and CPO on what “good” looks like can stabilize future collaboration.
opportunities.supportingQuote: They engaged Korn Ferry… “through an existing relationship initiated by the CEO.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Coordinate a joint check-in with the CEO and Jeanette to review lessons learned and agree governance, diversity expectations, and pace standards for future searches.

opportunities.title: Ongoing senior hiring support with faster execution
opportunities.description: As CPO working closely with the CEO on senior hiring, Jeanette is likely to need future executive search support, but with higher urgency, structure, and leadership than experienced here. Meeting these expectations is key to being considered again.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Jeanette is the Chief People Officer… “working closely with the CEO on senior hiring.”
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a refreshed executive search delivery model for Ocorian (clear timelines, governance, diversity commitments, and compensation benchmarking) to support upcoming senior roles.

opportunities.title: Independent succession evaluations to reduce blind spots
opportunities.description: Greg indicated a lack of confidence in their current succession/assessment matrix and wants third-party evaluations and analysis to ensure they are not missing risks or talent gaps.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I don't have any confidence in our matrix anymore. I think we need to have someone that is doing some of these... evaluations and analysis to make sure that we don't have blind spots."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Propose a structured succession assessment program (roles, readiness, risk, development plans) facilitated by Korn Ferry for the CEO and key executives.

opportunities.title: Expand into broader succession planning support
opportunities.description: Beyond the CEO replacement, Greg explicitly sees scope to involve Korn Ferry in improving succession planning and board-level understanding of leadership readiness.
opportunities.supportingQuote: He "see[s] potential to involve Korn Ferry in improving succession planning and reducing blind spots" and is "already exploring this with Korn Ferry."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule a follow-up working session with the Compensation/Governance Committees to scope succession planning deliverables, timeline, and stakeholders.

opportunities.title: Board-level governance and coaching support
opportunities.description: As chair of Compensation and Governance, Greg signaled openness to board-related support, implying an opportunity to extend services into governance effectiveness, committee advisory, or board coaching.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Key theme noted: "Opportunity for broader succession and board-related work" and recommendation to "Explore further work on succession planning and board coaching."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a board/committee effectiveness and governance advisory package aligned to their Compensation and Governance Committee priorities.

opportunities.title: Future executive search and leadership transitions
opportunities.description: Greg strongly indicated intent to reuse Korn Ferry, suggesting future needs for additional searches or leadership transition support as the organization evolves.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Would I ever use these people again? I can't imagine not using them again."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Establish a forward-looking talent roadmap conversation to identify upcoming leadership risks, retirements, and potential search needs over the next 12–24 months.

opportunities.title: Increase Korn Ferry visibility with client stakeholders
opportunities.description: Greg struggled to find issues but suggested Korn Ferry could strengthen its visibility, implying a need for more proactive presence/brand reinforcement with the board and broader stakeholder set.
opportunities.supportingQuote: He "struggled to identify any issues with the work itself, suggesting only that Korn Ferry could potentially strengthen its visibility."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Implement a light-touch visibility plan (periodic board-ready insights, check-ins, and thought leadership relevant to utilities leadership and governance).

opportunities.title: Proactively follow up to convert interest into work
opportunities.description: Greg’s strong advocacy and stated interest in succession work creates a near-term window to formalize next steps before momentum fades after the CEO transition.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Would I ever use these people again? I can't imagine not using them again." and he is "already exploring this with Korn Ferry."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set a specific next meeting date with Greg to define scope, outcomes, and a proposal for succession/board support within the next 2–3 weeks.

opportunities.title: Compensation benchmarking via independent partner model
opportunities.description: They needed CEO compensation benchmarking but could not use Korn Ferry due to perceived conflict, forcing them to engage another firm; future leadership changes will likely require a repeatable approach.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Korn Ferry does some of that, they were now a bit of a conflicted party. So we ended up having to go to... Meridian... [who] identify that we were 11% below market."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Offer a conflict-safe compensation benchmarking solution (clear independence boundaries or a vetted partner ecosystem) integrated into future CEO/executive transition projects.

opportunities.title: Sharpen assessment reports with executive summaries
opportunities.description: The client finds assessment documents too long and overly nuanced, and would prefer clearer, more decisive conclusions. Adding a short, “black and white” summary would make outputs more actionable for senior hiring decisions.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "The documents are long and very nuanced... you might sometimes maybe have wished them to be a little bit more black and white."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Add a 1-page executive summary to every assessment highlighting key strengths, risks, and clear behavioural calls.

opportunities.title: Make behavioural risk flags more explicit
opportunities.description: The CEO wanted more concrete statements on specific behaviours critical to transformation contexts (e.g., conflict handling, restructuring). More explicit behavioural “watch-outs” would increase confidence and speed decision-making.
opportunities.supportingQuote: He suggested clearer, more concrete statements on "ability to handle conflict and restructuring situations" and "on the very concrete things, how things will work."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Include a dedicated section in assessments for transformation-critical behaviours (conflict tolerance, restructuring leadership) with clear ratings and examples.

opportunities.title: Improve client visit logistics and parking
opportunities.description: A minor but repeated friction point was the inconvenience of parking when visiting the office. While not impacting perceived quality, it detracts from the premium experience.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "I'd wish they had parking spaces in their own office... it's a bit annoying."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Provide pre-arranged parking instructions/validation or offer alternative meeting options (client site/nearby venue/virtual) by default.

opportunities.title: Support transformation leadership and restructuring capability
opportunities.description: The company is in a transformation driven by a Bain-led review and profitability challenges, with a time-bound transformation role. This context suggests ongoing need for leadership advisory, org design, and restructuring/change support beyond the initial hires.
opportunities.supportingQuote: The CTO role was requested "to drive and follow up on transformation work" given "current profitability challenges," and the CEO emphasized restructuring/conflict capability.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Proactively propose a transformation support package (org/operating model, change leadership, restructuring support, leadership coaching) aligned to the Bain roadmap.

opportunities.title: Extend partnership through Solemn Partners network
opportunities.description: Solemn Partners already uses Korn Ferry extensively and influenced the selection, creating a clear path to broaden work across the portfolio and deepen the sponsor relationship.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "Oh, we work a lot, this is the main firm we also work with."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Coordinate with the Solemn Partners relationship owner to identify upcoming portfolio needs and position Korn Ferry for multi-company search and advisory engagements.

opportunities.title: Offer post-hire onboarding and integration support
opportunities.description: Two senior leaders have just joined (CHRO and CTO), and success will depend on fast integration in a transformation environment. Structured onboarding and coaching can protect the search outcome and create follow-on advisory work.
opportunities.supportingQuote: "The two people that are now on board..." and the transformation role is intended to deliver within ~2 years.
opportunities.suggestedAction: Schedule 30/60/90-day integration check-ins and offer executive coaching/onboarding support for the CHRO and CTO.

opportunities.title: Follow up to reinforce value after successful placements
opportunities.description: With both roles filled and high satisfaction, a timely follow-up can lock in advocacy and uncover next priorities (especially transformation milestones and HR leadership needs). This is a strong moment to formalize a longer-term partnership plan.
opportunities.supportingQuote: Overall experience was "very positive" and "strong satisfaction with the collaboration and with the appointees."
opportunities.suggestedAction: Set an executive debrief with the CEO and sponsor to review outcomes, capture lessons learned (including assessment format), and map next 6–12 month needs.

opportunities.title: Restore dual-consultant coverage on key searches
opportunities.description: The client experienced higher perceived value and richer consultation when two consultants with different cultural backgrounds attended meetings. Removing the paired model reduced differentiation and the overall experience, even though delivery still met expectations.
opportunities.supportingQuote: “That was the differentiating factor... two different individuals from two different cultures.” / “It still worked, but it was not the same great experience as we had at the beginning.”
